Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus we begin the treatment of the disease of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, since you have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, for the completion of its consequence in it, and for its explanations, and for its declarations, it seems to me that you complete what I have written in this treatise, which is part of the operation of my own hand, so it is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation of my hand is spread out in our region and in our time, entirely private, until the force of its science is felt, and its vigilance is stopped; and there remain no remnants of it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which muddy the more and induce error and hesitation until the intentions of it are closed and its strength is elongated and its art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that you will vivify this hand in the ordering of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and for which comes with the forms of the ferramentz of cautery and of the other instruments of the work as is necessary for addition to the declaration, and for preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why no one has been found to be a skilled artist in our time is that the art of medicine is long, and that it covers the entire actor within, which must be exercised in the science of anatomy, which includes Galen's knowledge until they know the juvenation of members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and has the consciousness of bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their number, and their inclination; and of pulsating veins and quiet ones, and of the places of their sediment.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason, Hippocrates said that a name is vain, unless it is manifest in the small work, and mainly in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this about that in the introduction of this book; because whoever does not know what we have said about anatomy, is not evacuated from error, for which they will die, just as you have seen many of them, because they are formatted in this science and get away from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Because you have seen a foolish doctor who has incidentally made an incision on the neck of a woman, and incidentally cut some arteries of the neck so that great blood flowed out until the woman almost died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who pretended to remove a stone from a man's bladder, which had progressed into his state, and the stone was large, and he came to him and tried to extract that stone with an instrument of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called him a destroyer, and I saw that due to the greatness of the stone and due to the disposition of the patient's body, he could not overcome it and would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he made a crude incision on the black crust which was devouring his fracture in the thigh; and with the doctor's ignorance, he estranged the fracture, above the wound, with poultices and astelas in a strong structure, and did not leave the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he dislocated the joints according to his foolish desires, and then he relaxed, and then he left it for some days and commanded that we should not disturb the limb; and it was thus until the thigh and the foot became apostematous, and he brought about loss.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you have already called him a destroyer, and he has been revealed to dislocate the limb, and consequently there is tranquility and thus also an increase of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption was confirmed in the limb, so that it could not be restrained, and it did not cease to walk with the corruption in the limb until the patient's condition worsened.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous apostem, and it became ulcerated afterwards for some days, until the malignancy of it was magnified in his lord's sense.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason is that the cancerous tumor was pure melancholic humor, then it did not cover that it would come to him with iron of all, but rather that it was a member which suffered from all, as if it had been held back.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation of my hand be divided into two devotions: one is an operation associated with health, and another work in which there is danger in major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already existed in every place of this book where I have opposed operation in which there is error and fear; because it is necessary for you to guard against that and leave it, so that the fools do not find a way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your arms in solicitude and protection of God, and your maladies are felicitated and fortified.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And you will follow the best way for the grace of God to obtain health and laudable success, and leave behind the terrible maladies of difficult healing, and leave behind your arms from that which makes you afraid, so that you may establish faith in your heart and in your name you are not evasive: because more remains in your glory, and thus also in the world and finally in your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Some fevers are released in certain evil humors:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	There is no bad doctor who does not know the name of a bad disease.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Here begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the head and feet, in the forms of instruments and in the furnishings of cauteries, and of what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on suction and perforation, and of cupping glasses, and of plasters, and of extraction of arrows and of similar things, all chaptered and ordered according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and of curvature of twisted limbs and of similar things; a chapter ordered from head to feet, and according to the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	About cautery, I will speak and provide acute medicine and remember the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	Here begins the treatise on the whole book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will discuss the quality of the juices of that cautery and of its instruments, and in which complexity it is prohibited to use cauteries.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the sermon on the quality of the juice of cautery and of its instrument is long and prolix, subtle for science, and secretly hidden; and already many wise men have spoken about it, and they are discordant among themselves, and to me it seems sufficient to take a small part of their sermons, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cauteries universally correspond to all complexity in matter or matters, except for two complexities, which are cold complexities without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In cold and dry complexity with matter they disagree; for some said that cauteries are helpful for that, and others said the contrary of that, that cauteries are not convenient in illnesses which are due to quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that cold and dry illnesses are healed by hot and dry cauteries.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And I say to him who says the contrary of that, that by cauteries it is made helpful in all cold and dry illnesses that occur in men's bodies, because when you compare men's bodies with the humidity of them to the complexity of fire, you find men's bodies are fragile.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say through the sermon of that, that I have experimented and already discovered many times in my life.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	Moreover, I do not think that it is necessary to speak about that which has already been experimented and exercised in the chapter on cauteries by previous exercise, and to know the diversity of complexity of men's bodies and the disposition of illnesses in their members, and the causes of those, and the accidents of those, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	Moreover, in the other complexities, it is not about your fear, and mainly in fragile and humid illnesses, because already all doctors have agreed on those, and do not disagree on the help of cauteries in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you know, sons, that the secret of cure by cauteries is fire and its goodness, so concerning cauteries I am combining medicine, because fire is simple, the action of which does not pass except to the member that is cauterized and does not harm another member unless it is a small nuisance.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Moreover, the action of combining medicine passes to that in the members where it is united, and strengthens their coming into the ill member with difficult healing and strengthens their assistance.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Moreover, fire, through its sublime quality and good substance, does not do anything but overflow; and it is already known to us through experiment and the length of service in studying the art about the truth of causes; and for that I am excused from the length of this sermon. And if it were not that it is not read in my book on this subject, you would have a secret hidden fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and of its expulsion through which it expels illnesses, a philosophical sermon demonstrated, which would be acutely seen in your pious steps.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you know, sons, that they disagree on the time in which it is convenient to use cauteries and pause at the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauteries are convenient at all times, because the nuisance from the accidental time is submerged in the help of that which I have said about cauteries, and mainly if the cauteries are for pains or necessary pains, strong and steadfast, which do not suffer tardiness because they fear those that come with evil, which is greater than small nuisance entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus it is not hidden in your steps, or, sons, that which is not esteemed except by the common people and foolish doctors, so it is that for that illness which is healed by cauteries it is not returned at all times, and pauses that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not seen thus by those who do not understand it, because cauteries are not but in place of medicine which alters the complexity and dries the humidity which are the causes why pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	More masters should excel in superficial medicine to validate its value and virtue of their operation and greatness of their lord's sense.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the disease returns at some hour of time, according to the complexity of the patient and the location of their disease, and its virtue, and what has been prepared in the body by the aggregation of superfluous fluids, and what has been received by it in its acquisition of vices and semblances of those causes; unless the disease in which a cautery is administered is a subtle disease in a member with few superfluous fluids and humidity, thus as a cautery on the teeth for pain and semblance to that, it is possible that in it no return of that pain occurs, but rather it happens in a small way.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common speech is that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and it is a desperate remedy, not because they understand it, since they believe that it is not a cure that profits from medicine nor another cause that profits from cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine is not but when we administer many ways of cure in certain diseases, and those medicines do not confer, and at the end of the cause we administer thus cautery, and it profits from that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And therefore it is clear that cautery is not the last resort of medicine, but according to the intention which is understood by the common people and foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that ancient people believed that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not make a breach, as it is not absolutely virtuous, because you already have it probed and experimented that it does not do this except in certain bodies, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron, thus as they said; but more masterfully when you make cautery with a focus of gold, it is not declared to you, because it is ignited according to the quantity that you want for the rigor of the gold, and then prepares to receive heat; and if you adjust it above the ignition, the gold melts per focus, and also in the focus certain laminas are made so that the artisan can occupy himself with that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason, it is done to make cautery with iron, we cannot push lightly and more profoundly into the rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And now I have ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that one can easily find what one wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cautery for pain in the head due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers on the humidity and coldness above the accidental service of which there are two causes, so it is a cause of swelling and multitude of rheumatic flux, called corrosion, from the head to the parts of the shoulders and ears flowing, and multitude of drowsiness, and of toothache and gout, and universally of all disease that comes from coldness, thus as paralytically, swelling and apoplexy, and similarly in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is this, that primarily it commands the patient to be evacuated from medicine lacative mind, for three or four nights, according to the virtue of the patient and their age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then it commands them to shave their head with a razor, and then make a seat between the thighs above a heated bench and place their hands on their chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor of your palm then put the fingers on the razor between the nostrils of your nose.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More masterfully, as the finger said of my own place is received, it signs that place with tension, and then ignites the cautery olive wood of which this is the form.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the place marked with tension, in a way that descends, as which the finger of mine is constricted little by little, and you revolve that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and regard the place, and if you see already of the bone being discovered some quantity of the head, thus as the quantity of grains of errors, then lift your hand, and if it does not turn to your hand in that iron, another of that, if it is frozen, until it is seen by the bone what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it over the place and let it sit for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place it on the covered cloth in a bundle and let it sit until the crust of the focus is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place with angelic tetrafarmacon until it is healthy.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plague was uplifted, so many wounds got healed, because it is better and more youthful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that some of them who had been cautery-ized on the back bone until to the bone, and held the cautery until it was adhered to some part of the specific bone.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then you should rasp that which is adhered to the bone, and then you should cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They say that others who apply the cautery to the back, so that it penetrates into the bone strongly, and this is the way of making small incisions:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they think that from that place they extract the vapors from the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And it has been held in an open wound for a long time, and then you should cure it until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two special kinds of cauteries at all, unless in some homes according to the way of fear; and thus, you see, I am better, for it is said that salvation is when the head is freed from the continuous solution of the same, as we have testified in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cautery is mostly safe and better, I see; and from that house and in that work, I am saved.
Capitol segon.	Head according to.
Del cauteri del cap.	About the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When the whole head is affected by chronic and long pain, and it is in a prolonged patient, and uses remedies such as poultices and bandages and capillaries and implants and gauzes and cadels and wadding, and especially if it has been cauterized with a cautery that recounts and does not profit from any of those causes, then consider that the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not frail and weak, then that cautery is another cautery below that one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then you should cauterize above the horn of the sieve-like head with a cautery, so that the cord is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the cord and uncover the bone as much as we have recounted and cauterize it with a cautery in the back part of the head at the place called "vas" - and it is that place where the wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand in this way, and do not uncover the bone, because the patient suffers from great diverse pain due to that, rather than the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you will direct this cautery to its place, because it is known that the cautery which cauterizes the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cautery than the one that is cauterized in the middle place of the head; and this is the way of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cautery of non-ancient migrating [humors].
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain is felt in the head, or it is a sudden pain until the vein, then evacuate with mondifying medicines of the mundane head, and administer another cure, which you have said in the divisions of the diseases; and if it does not profit, then cautery is done in two ways: either cautery with acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	One cautery with acute burning medicine is that you take a handful of salt, and scrape it and bind the extremities of the hand with both heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then you incise the place of pain in the temple with a sharp lancet, so that it is in the same location below the cord, so that it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then you strengthen it above the hand that is stopped by constant constriction, and thus it remains for three hours; and then you dissolve the poultice and remove the salt, and thus the wound is opened for two or three days, and then you pause on the underlying part submerged in water until the place forms a crust.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then you cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you see, make some burning medicines which I have written in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	One cautery with iron is done according to this method: ignite for cautery of which this is the way.
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "claus clavilhs", because the head of it is thus formed like a key in which there is some curvature, and in the middle place of it there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then you pause on the place of pain, and hold your hand - so that the artery which is beneath is not hurt - and turn the small iron little by little with velocity.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it which is hurt by the specification of the cord thus as the magnitude of it, and raise your hand so that the artery which is beneath is not hurt, so that there is no flux of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then you immerse the part in salt water and pause it on the place, and thus it remains for three days; and then you pause the part well-covered in bandage, and then you cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cautery is done on the extremity of the cutter according to cautery, and beware of incision of artery in this non-ancient migrating [humors] properly.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cautery of ancient migrating [humors].
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migrating disease that we have spoken of in the previous treatment, and which we have mentioned in the divisions of the illnesses, and do not hasten the treatment, and sometimes for the illness that does not abound to what we have said of the first cautery in medicine or of the cautery in focus, then you should ignite the cautery tool within so it is whitened, because it indicates above the line of the long disease which is the greatest part of what has been said; and pause your hand for a moment and strengthen it inside to incise the artery and penetrate inside the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful about the continuity of the jawbone, which is weakened by chewing, and that the ligament is not injured and the nerves are not affected by that, so that spasms do not occur.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood in the artery that is blocked, because in the blockage of it there is fear, and mostly to one who ignores what he does and is not skilled and experienced; and thus the operation begins on him at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find remedy in remembering the rule of blood flow regulation according to the usual method, at the usual place of this free treatment.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness does not abound to this cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, then cautery it in the middle place of the head thus as we have recounted, and cure the plague until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter of straightening of arteries with cautery having two handles, and it is a better cauteryization, more convenient.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the Cauterization of Ear Pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain due to cold and it is treated with causative remedies and another treatment which has been said in the division, and the pain is not alleviated, then ignite the cautery, and this is the one that has been named pointed, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And place the point at the ignition, and it should be directed towards the environment of the entire ear thus as a wheel is turned around, or in a circle of some sort if the pain is somewhere.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Also, you have the cautery of the root of the ear little by little, because then you will feel the spot where you are trying.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you cautery multiple points throughout the entire ear, and that is it, and then cure the spots until they are healthy.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the Cauterization of Turture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turture, which is treated and cautery is not only for the species that come from flux, according to what we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	It is necessary to cautery the species that comes from dryness or from spasm of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of turture with herbs and capillary and gargling, and do not complete your treatment, then it is necessary to cautery the illness in three cauteries: the first is at the root of the ear, and the second is a little below the usual temple, and the third is at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause your cautery tool for the opposite part of the ailing area, because mollification is not seen except in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cautery is that you cautery it with the cautery tool in the direction of the extremity of the ear, then slightly above the crown of the head, and in another temple, the length of which is according to the length of the said bone, and pause your hand on the cautery until the quantity of the greatness of the species of the codeina is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery tool, and it is a species of cutting instrument, the form of which is described in detail.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle because one little thing is thus as you see; and it is necessary to cut in the excessive fat a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the spot where it is described, until it is healthy.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the Cauterization of Ancient Apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you treat it with what we have said and do not complete your medication and the illness does not have fever, then cautery it with four cauteries: on all the crowns of the head; and with cautery in the middle place of the head, as we have said; and with cautery on the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done according to what has been said before.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is already cautered above the mouth of the stomach; and it is more difficult; and then it is cured with what proceeds.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the Cauterization of Oblivion Caused by Flux.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is necessary to give to the patient at the beginning large doses and pills that are wonderfully serving.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then raise the entire thigh of the patient and place it on the wooden splint described in the treatise on splints.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Place those warm cloths, because that is the manner of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do it according to the method which I have already described.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And therefore if the patient is sane; and if not, then make three cauteries on the upper part of the head, which descend from the upper part of the head down to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the thick padding of the finger between each cautery, and then take care to make the cautery with what is proceeding.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you find the patient is tolerant, then make the cautery in a middle place; and if you find greater tolerance, then cauterize above the two horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Take care to bring it inside so that it may be healthy; and let the olive-shaped cautery be according to the form previously given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of paralysis and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Because you are proceeding in mondification of the head with gums and with what we have said; and then raise the patient's head, and then cauterize it with cauteries in the middle place of the head, and cauterize above all the horns of the head, and cauterize above the upper part of it, and three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the case of softening of the body due to many illnesses and the patients are tolerant and the illness is strong, then cauterize it with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and afterwards make cauteries until it is relieved of the cold humors, and raise the tie that holds it.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And take care to bring it inside so that it may be healthy, and let this olive-shaped cautery be.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not that the epileptic is cauterized, but rather that epilepsy is due to flux.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore it is necessary to mondify the brain of the patient at the beginning of the year and in the other cure, which we have dictated in the division when the patient is great and is tolerant of the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is an infant who cannot tolerate medicines, then administer gentle gargles and moderate servings of mondifying wine, beforehand for several days, with good purification of the veins.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And raise the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle place of the head according to the previous manner, and another cautery on the back of the head, and above each horn of the head it is cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize it with the cauteries which I have said, having paralyzed and softened the body over the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the olive-shaped cautery be according to what has been previously stated.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is an infant, then place a subtle cautery according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and gross flaccidity, then cauterize it with the cauteries which I have said in the paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is superfluous declining to melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give him something that purifies his brain according to what has been previously stated in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And raise the patient's head, and then make a tortoise-shaped decently made device of lead on the circle, and then place it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated comfortably, and let him be held firmly by all parties.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; and it is better to use an old broth of sheep's milk.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over the fire for temperate warmth by measure, which is said to be sufficient when it is mixed with it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then put that in the middle of the patient's head in the circle, and let him be until he is refreshed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And make the patient take it for a whole week, once a day, as the other regimen of his good health; or if you wish, cauterize it by making small points according to the size of the head, but keep your hand in one cautery thus ordered: this is a special kind of cautery that humidifies the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then apply that cooked in a broth or in grayish juices of walnut.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of descending water in the vein.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have declared the beginning of water in the vein through the signs which I have said in the division, then begin and give to drink to the patient something that purifies his head, and keep him from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And it makes that sweating in bath water through various joints.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to shave the head cap, and cauterize that with a pointed cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize that with two cauteries on both temples if there is beginning of watering in both eyes, or on one side if there is beginning of watering in one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Including the cauteries to all the veins and arteries, which are seen descending from the spine; and place the cauteries in that length along the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of fluxes of blood when it is cauterized; and if you see the fluxes of blood, stop with some medicine, which is as much as possible.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you will find wisdom in the extraction of arteries and in the removal of those and caution of fluxes of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauterized at the neck below two bones with two cauteries, thereby producing a remedy.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are old and assuaged through the veins and arteries which are in the manifest place of the head before, and it is verified that this is superfluous fluid matter, then cauterize that with a pointed cautery which we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of watering in the eyes, and cauterize in the middle of the head and with two cauteries at the neck below both temples, and with two cauteries at the neck below both bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you find indication of addition, then cauterize that on the entire side of the eye over the extremity of the eyebrow with a small pointed cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of foul odor of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you medicate that with what we have said in the division and do not hasten your medication, then prepare and give to the patient three nights' worth of medicines; and place a bandage around the head, and cauterize that with a cautery made from a mixture of olive oil and other ingredients.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a clave-shaped cautery, with two cauteries on both eyebrows below the hair, a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the artery that you do not injure it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the clave-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cauterization of relaxation of the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is relaxed due to weakness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a lunar-shaped cautery; and this is its form.
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do, cauterize that over both eyebrows a little with two cauteries on the entire partition, and thus elongate the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but rather according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid should be touched.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cauterization of the eyelid of the eye when the skin is converted into inward-growing parts and pierces the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eye is converted into inward-growing parts and thus pierces the eye, cauterize in those cases according to two methods, because the cautery is either with iron or with combustible medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize it with a focus, command the patient to stay within that which reads the six skin layers thus as those which are in the world, until they are prolonged and strengthened; and if it pierces that which needs its nourishment, then strengthen the eyes of the patient with a bandage so that it is not weakened until the skin is born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are born and strengthened, then pause the head of the patient in the tieu seat, and place a sign above the eyelid of the eyes of the patient with a tent, with a signal that is according to the figure of a leaf of myrtle, and it is the beginning of the signal proper of the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then pause, covered in an album of wool or in a mucilage of powder over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cautery, of which this is its form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure which is signed, little by little, in moistened motifs, until the surface of the spine which is thus like a leaf of myrtle, entirely apparent properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the signal of sanity of the entire work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the skin of it elevated from the punctuation of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it there for three days, and then pause over the entire surface with a border until the scar is eradicated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with an ointment until it is healthy.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the skin returns to its original cause and the eyelid is relaxed, then make another vein for the cautery over that entire thing, just as you had done primarily.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the skin is on the eyelid, then it should be elevated to its natural position and be cleansed so that the skin does not touch the wheel.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	The cautery in medicine is a burning remedy that commands the patient to lift their skin so that it is prolonged and cleansed, and then make a chart of the fabric of the mirror-like skin.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take soap of walnut and cause living water to flow from the wound. And then take soap of walnut and cause living water to flow into the ulcer. Where the water is, and then mix those causes well, and make that an antidote so that it is not frozen; and then spread that over the chart which was made thus in the form of a mirror-like skin, and place that on one wheel of two; and place the wheel with the coto (knot) embedded in album of wool, and the head of the patient be in the position of the tie.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the finger on the medicine and press it a little so that the patient does not feel the bitterness of the medicine, because bitterness is in it as if from fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And thus as you will perceive that the bitterness is gone, then leave the medicine and take it to the same finger; thus as the bitterness ceases, then remove the medicine and wash the wheel with water; and then consider if sometimes the eyelid is lifted thus as if washed from constriction or incision, because then it will be; and if not, return to that of the medicine on the place where you did not apply the medicine and do not deny until your operation is cleansed and the wheel is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place on the knot with the bandage to eradicate the venom of the adjustment, and then cure it with a definite unguent or another so that it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, from your operation to keep diligent vigilance so that the medicine does not fall on the wheel, and if the eyelid is mollified after some days and any cause of skin touches the wheel, then iterate your medicine on the place where the eyelid is mollified, and properly thus as it was done at the beginning, and then envelop it so that it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of the mirror-like skin.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the wheels of men are diversified according to magnitude and smallness, and thus according to what was made your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And it will not be confused with the way of straightening towards that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fistula with water that we have spoken of in the divisions of illnesses and do not confuse your cure, then be careful to cauterize it according to this method: command the patient to place their head thus in the position, and hold the head of some minister between the positions more in such a way that it is not moved nor agitated by the head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a knot embedded in an album of wool or in a mucilage of ptilly over the wheel of it.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cautery of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which should be conquered, thus as it is a form of cane or of wing of a volturer, from one extremity to the other where the cautery was made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see, it should penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out thus as you stretch.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, I command that which is concave is better at the tender work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then take the fistula if it is open, and draw out its humor and dry that.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then operate on it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place on it the cautery which was ignited, and you have that in hand a little away from the cautery of the wheel at the bridge of the nose, so that it does not hurt your hand or the patient is not disturbed, and then place the cautery in the grooves of the wheel and corrode that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And thus at the beginning of the wheel cautery, you will perceive into the bone, well; and if not, then iterate the cautery once or twice, if it is necessary; and leave that thus for three days, and then place on that knot with a bandage and envelop it with an unguent exsiccatiu until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if they have passed eleven days and it is not healed, then place on the medicine with an acute corrosive until the bone is uncovered and is scraped according to what is convenient in the seventh chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And it is another method of cautery of fistula which the first doctors discovered: then in the place of the fistula and do that and place on that fissure subtly, of which this is the form of it: Put in that a quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and you have your hand in subtle good retention, and do not move the patient so that the melted lead does not penetrate to the wheel of it; and take care to place on the wheel of the patient a knot embedded in an album of wool or in water, because the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by marvelous sanitation.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula is healed by what we have said about the cautery and treatment, it is well; and if not, then it is necessary to administer treatment through the nose and reduce the fistula in its proper place in the body according to how it will return to its own location.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the ulceration of the toes.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Mouth ulcers appearing suddenly in the lips, and worsening in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those ulcers as we have said in the divisions and do not deepen your treatment, then ignite the small cutting cautery according to this form that is taught:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And it is the conquest of the patient according to the subtlety of his skin.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then stop that instrument carefully in those ulcers until the cautery penetrates to the root of the ulcers.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that wound with cerate until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When on the root of the uvula or on the palate or on the roots of the teeth, an abscess is formed and then breaks, and it is ruptured, and it is antiquated, and correct breaking and it makes a fistula, and then you treat that and do not deepen your treatment, then it is necessary to ignite the cautery according to the quantity that has been received in the fistula, and then place that ignition in the tract of the fistula, and hold your hand until it penetrates to the iron ignited at the root of it, and afterwards make one or two ulcers; and then treat that wound as we have said about the treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And then if the wound is abscessed and healed, it is well; and if not, then it is necessary to discover the location and remove the corrupted bone according to how it will return to its own chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines and do not confide, then stop the head of the patient in the same place, and ignite the cautery in the form that will come to be thus, also so that you stop the handle on the tooth and insert it into the ignited cautery, holding your hand for a little while, until the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth where the ignited cautery has penetrated.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and then iterate the cautery several times according to how you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should hold his mouth full of salt water for an hour, and afterwards spit it out, because the decayed tooth is strengthened and the softened gum is toned up and the corrupted humidity is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by coldness, or there is cold or worm in it, or does not confide in the treatment with medicine, then cautery is applied to that in two ways: either cautery with a cow's horn, or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a cow's horn is that you take a cow's horn and boil it in a cauldron of iron, and then take a thread and wrap it around the extremity of the instrument, and then merge it into the boiling horn, and stop it on the painful tooth firmly until it is cooled down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then iterate that several times until the virtue of the fire penetrates to the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, submerge the thread or instrument in the aforementioned horn, and stop it on the aching tooth, and stop on that ignited iron until the iron penetrates to the root of the conquest of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	Moreover, the emperor ordered that cauterization with fire is that you attend to the quantity of iron or iron, and it is in the heart of some gross humor and the acuity of the fire does not penetrate to the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form that will come, and stop it on the tooth and hold your hand until the cautery is cooled down; and do this several times because the pain will be relieved or on that day or the next day.
