E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that by impression of that cautery the patient should hold his mouth full of good horn and keep it for an hour and then spit it out; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize with what you wish to extirpate according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of tumors.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When tumors are of phlegm and cold humors and do not obey digestion through medicines and you wish to digest those lightly, then you ignite the cautery in the form that is this: having two extinguished extremities so that they may receive the fumes from the cautery through the other extremity, and stop the ignited cautery on the abscess one time, and another if it is necessary for that, until it penetrates to the root of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	If the aposteme is small, then pause the cautery according to the quantity of the aposteme, and then lift it for three days and place it on the affected area until it is well-cooked in order to consume what the fire has burned.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that which is wounded and torn, and draw together until it is whole again.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or of two cauteries is such as to convoke.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of wounds of the foot and of constrictions of the thigh.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes over the canal of the lung, and especially when that is accompanied by complexity of phlegm, then it is necessary for the patient to be evacuated at the beginning with medicines that are laxative, and then cauterize that which has deviated from the rule in the predetermined place.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And beware that you do not penetrate with the cautery to the rule of the thigh, nor do you burn the code of it except a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that which is beyond the cautery deviated from the joint of the neck in the back spinal cord of it.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let the cautery of it be shaped according to the previous manner.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that which is preceded until it is whole again.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization of diseases of the lung and of coughs.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When coughs and diseases of the lung are from cold humors and the patient has no fever nor thirst, and it is an ancient disease, then cauterize that which is with two cauteries on the forked part in the predetermined places, and with another cautery in the middle place of the chest between two nipples; and let the cautery be shaped according to the previous form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cauterization be pointed with the cautery that is called a point, the form of which precedes in the pointing out of pain of the ears.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And make points until it reaches those; and then heal that which is preceded until it is whole again.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And now let the cautery have three ramps because the cauterization is in this way: you can make three cauteries according to this form.

De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of gout that is at the head of the help.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the help is dislocated by reason of lubricating cold humors and it is not fixed at the hour of its usual return, until it is in its usual custom of returning, and then for a small movement it is dislocated thus that it is ended, as we have testified, then it is necessary to reduce the dislocation first, and then let the patient be reversed on his back or on his side; and then lift the code which is in the inner part of the citillic to the upper parts with your left hand, if the joint is dislocated below.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then ignite the cauteries having two heads; and this is their form.
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the code until it penetrates into the other side; and you will find the figure of cauterization with four heads of cauteries.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And thus those subtleties according to the quantity of tension; and this is their form.
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And some views are adjusted according to this count and because they are the eight cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then pause on the cautery, piercing as in salt, and then make the patient adhere to tranquility, and the limb should not be moved for any time until it is comforted.

And if the dislocation is above and it is done thus, then cauterize on the muscle with a shaped cautery or with three pointed cauteries, because the joint is confirmed and the humidity is removed and the patient is healed.

De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When cold comes into the stomach and many cold humors enter to extract its completeness and it is multiplied in it, and if you continue the manners of cure and do not confuse them, then it is necessary for the patient to be on his back with his arms extended and his thighs, and then cauterize that which is with three cauteries: one cautery below the chest according to the quantity of a finger in a shaped cautery, and two cauteries below the sides of the chest, until the figure of the triangular cautery appears; and elongate between those that are not adjusted so that they will make a purge.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is according to the quantity of the two tiers of the thickness of the code.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cautery be according to this form, and if you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle place of the stomach according to this form; and let this be a cautery according to the circular form according to this form.

And let the stomach be cauterized pointedly at that which is frightened by this cautery: and it is that you feel on the stomach point according to the quantity that you wish with tension, and then cauterize that which is with a pointed cautery; and then heal that which is with the cure that precedes until it is whole again.

De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	About the cauterization of the feverish foot.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When the foot is painful due to coldness or humidity or excessive wind entering, which disrupts its normal complex structure and causes superfluous egress, and it is cured by the method we have described and not by comforting, then it is necessary that the patient be placed on their back, and three cauterizations are applied in this form and quantity, measuring them above the foot just below the hips, so that the decubitus of the man is perceived.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space be between each cautery according to the thickness of the digit, and let the cautery be according to the length of the right body.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not comprehend with your hand when applying the cautery movement.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the quantity of water that has been absorbed is equal to the quantity of the majesty of the specific codeina, and it does not need further adjustment; and if the patient stands on their feet; and if they are not standing, then let them sit, who has already extended their thighs, and raised their legs.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible that you can cauterize these cauteries with a cutting cautery, when you are subtle and prudent in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And beware that you do not proceed too far in the cauterization, and let the specific codeina of the whole body be absorbed so that it is absorbed throughout the entire body and penetrates into the intestines, because the codeina here is subtle; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	About the perforation of an abscess on the foot with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is an ulcer or abscess on the foot and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the foot or in its tendon, then if it is in the flesh of the foot, the patient will feel heavy and grave pain, and their suffering will be acute.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tendon of the foot, then the pain is greatly acute and often the doctors are exhausted from treating it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore it is necessary that the patient be turned onto their back; and place a sign on the area of the abscess with a probe; and place a ignited cautery, which is assembled like a rag, in the form that was described on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that cautery until the entire codeina is combined, until it penetrates to the ciphalic, until it reaches the sana.

E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not necessary that this form of cautery be used unless the one who has studied in the art of medicine has prolonged it, and in many of which most maladies are known; more, I have experimented with some vague things being said about this operation, but I will leave that to you, and it is better.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	About the cauterization of wounds.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient cauteries of the roots of Aristology wounded in this manner, being made by those who took from the roots of Aristology a long and dry root that is found, and it is of the thickness of the digit.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then submerge it in oil and expose it to fire, and then cauterize with a cautery at that place where the furcula meets the neck; and there are two small cauteries below guiding, one slightly declining towards the part that is below the beard, and two cauteries on what declines between the fifth rib and the cisterna, declining slightly towards the back parts; and another cautery in the middle of the foot; and another on the stomach, and three cauteries on the back parts; and a cautery at that place where it is between the two shoulders, and two cauteries of the two sides of the foot, below the cautery which is between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is not necessary that you comprehend with your hand on the cauteries, but rather it should be in the manifestation of the codeina in operation.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And thus I have described the ancient cauteries that are similar to those of men who use iron-like cauteries resembling a ray and igniting them, and placing them in that place which is between the ribs, until they penetrate to that abscess and healthy sania is restored, just as we have said in the case of the abscess on the foot.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	More, in this perforation with cauteries, there is no fear, because I have seen that it often happens that the cautery accidently falls on the fistulous place where it does not heal.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	About the cauterization of the hernia.

When you treat the malady of the hernia with what we have said about the cure in the division and do not contradict your cure, then cauteries are applied in three ways, all of which are direct, one of which is to make three or four lines according to the length of the hernia, according to the figure of the cauteries on the foot, the figure of which has preceded.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment. E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cautery with a cautery having three virtues.

And then you cure the cautery, so that it has been freed from getting broken for three years, because many are more confident that the other causes preceding in the cure.

De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the Cautery of Dropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauteries are not made in dropsy, but rather in a circular manner properly.

E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient from cure then with the cautery, which is necessary for that to be added to the two intentions, and will be fixed to the healthy assistant.

The shape of the cautery which is cauterized on the belly is club-shaped according to the shape of that which precedes, and it is that which is cauterized on the back which is olive-shaped according to its preceding form.

De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On the Cautery of Old Hemorrhoids.

Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On cauterization of the thigh, afterwards remove them (the cauteries).

Afterwards insert the ignited rod into that removed thigh, and ultimately stop the flow so that the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood flows.

Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On cauterization of fistulas that are formed in the patient's nature, divided into their parts.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When the patient's nature does not obey the work that we have recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened by it, then heal with a cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore when someone has a fistula in their nature behind, and it is ancient, corroding the healthy part of them and corrupting the humidity, and therefore that which is more worthy than covering is that one proceeds with a subtle probe, and afterwards conveys the quantity of the profundity of them before the aforementioned probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Afterwards ignite the cautery that resembles a rod.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And afterwards insert that ignited cautery into this fistula, and according to the quantity in which it intersects with the probe.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And hold the cautery over that fistula until the corrupt bodies are completely burned, one or two or three times, according to the quantity of your necessary need.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And beware of combustion of nerves and veins; or if the fistula goes to the body of the bladder or to the body of the intestine, then beware of all those places; and do not do it unless the fistula is in a fleshy place and you think that it does not penetrate.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And afterwards take care of the place until it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed, and you have removed from it the bad matters, and it remains like that for a long time, then you will know that it has been entirely cured.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the bad matters are not removed from it, then you will know that it is penetrating or in the vicinity of the corrupted bone, or it falls into those causes which will be remembered in its place.

De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On cauterization of the veins.

De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterialization of the sciatic vein.

And I will describe the wise men in the cauterialization of the ankle, which is this method: make it similar to a circle of iron, from which the circuit is the size of a palm; and let it be with seven orifices according to the greatness of a finger's bone or a little less.

Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray. De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	About cauterization of fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre. E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And then follow the patient between your hands on the seventh day, and command him to hold his seven wings inside so that it will be fortified or the intestine or hernia will not come out.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return that to the ties of the fingers and sew it in order to hold the rupture on the bone of the pentagonal shape, signaling the extremity of which is similar to the circle at the subtler parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then ignite the cautery of which this is its form:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it becomes very red and has many sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then pause the cautery on that sign with your hand on the cautery standing upright, and then on that until you have consecrated the bone of the pentagonal shape into the middle of the divine; and afterwards on that other occasion if you have not achieved it in the first occasion until the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe carefully the movement of the intestine during the time of your cautery, that you do not burn that intestine so that on the patient there will come no death or other great evil.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you have the cautery, do not touch the bone, it does not confer your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	It is necessary that the cautery of the children be subtle according to their age and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And then treat the area of the cautery for three days with gentle entry so that the crust of the wound is removed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat those who have other wounds until they are healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	The patient should sit on a soft cushion for forty days until the area and plague are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	It is necessary to pause the nourishment of it according to the length of time of its cure, which empties the belly of it, and that the intestine does not come out during the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then when one wants to get up after forty days, then administer gentle and decent food, and hold that for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And it is warned about exertion and replenishment of food and drink, and violent vomiting, because when one uses this entire regimen of healing, they will be entirely healthy.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will direct the healing of ruptures in other parts of the belly, and so from the beginning, and you should not delay, then cauterize the rupture of that which is being cauterized repeatedly according to its quantity, and it is what is expelled from the intestine thus like the third part of it; and then treat that which has been said, and do not adjust.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And I will show some first cases where the rupture is cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is marked on the tent.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	and it is a paused line that goes through the width in the lattice above the rupture, and another line below; and I place my hand on a key-shaped cautery, but the first cautery is better and more gentle.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the Cauterization of Hernia.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain occurs in some members due to a fall or percussion and persists for a long time and does not respond to medical treatment, then it is necessary to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And it is the cautery of each member according to its size and smallness, and its virtue and development, and location of hernia and pain of it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	So if it is not healed by the first cautery, well; and if not, then iterate over it with the cautery; because of the custom of those pains it is that they are punctured in a member next to that member which approaches the one, so that it is necessary to continue with the cautery until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the Cauterization of Leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some leprous wounds are treated with a cautery for great joy, and magnificently if the type of leprosy that is made by putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And thus as you want to cauterize that, consider if the leprosy is common and as it is cured with what we have said in the division and not delayed, nor this, and fear about the patient whose corruption comprehends all of their body and all its complexity, then cauterize that on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and one below it, and at the forehead to the end of the hair; and two above the horns; and one behind, on the nape or service.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally place your hand on the cautery a little while into the bone to make a small impression, and from it the scabs are dislocated, so that the expiration of gross vapors is alleviated from it; and cauterize on the marrow according to what is prescribed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient and appears manifestly, then it is necessary to cauterize that with those cauteries which we have said on the head; and one cautery on the extremity of the nose, and two cauteries on each shoulder blade, and two cauteries on two vertebrae of the neck, and six cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and one large one on the vertebrae near the coccyx, and one on the coccyx, and two on each hip, and one on each thigh, and two on each knee, and one on each shin, and two on each ankle, and two on each muscle, and two on the tendons of the foot; and cauterize that on all the joints of the said limbs and feet, and on each talon of the soles of the feet, and on the soles of their hands.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And beware of the nerves which are above the ankle that you do not touch those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And some wounds are treated with a cautery on the bone of the penis and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you know that the more you adjust cauteries, the more joyful and confident it is; and you know that the patient does not have pain in the cautery, thus like they have said, because the body of it is already stupified.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And it is necessary that the cauteries are large or small according to the members and joints as it is preceded by the species of the instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should burn the cautery iron in fine powder of iris root, mixing it with honey and another treatment inside so that it may be healthy.

De cauterizacio de stupor.	On the cauterization of numbness.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When some member is numb or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and emplasters, and it is not healthy, then you cauterize that numb member with cauteries according to the size of the member or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery enter into the narrowness of the channel of the spine a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And you should take care to insert it gently so that it may be healthy.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes veins are cauterized for some numbness which goes to the hands and feet, and to the vertebrae of the back and it is felt in the movement of the nerves which govern that member, and the numbness is relieved.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not press on it except for what is known from the anatomy of the members and the exit of the nerves to the moving whole body.

De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cauterization of ulcers that are gangrene.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When ulcers are old and do not respond to the usual remedies of medicine, then you cauterize on that place with a pointed cautery a little according to the quantity of the specificity of the spine until the whiteness and color of it are restored, and its color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And you should take care to make powder from roots and lentils with rose oil and leaves of dragon plant, and blood of dove or blood of pigeon, each one being a part and all are mixed together, and then anoint a bandage and place it on the area until it is healthy.

De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cauterization of cancer.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer is beginning and you want to remove it, then cauterize that place with a circular cautery in the circumference of it, just as it is turned around.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas. De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On the cauterization of indurations.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some induration is delayed in maturity, and it is because of the superfluous fat that makes it, or because of the state of the patient, since it is old and decrepit, with little blood, or because of time, and you want to hasten its maturity; then cauterize around it with many small pointed cauteries; and you should leave it so that it may be hastened in maturity.

Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the cauterization of corroding ulcers.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corroding ulcer is a corrupting ambulation in the member, which corrodes that place just as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Then if you want to cauterize that corroding ulcer in the place where it suffers from fire, then you should ignite cauteries with many small nails, and large ones according to what is convenient in that place where it is corroding.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And you should cauterize the whole part until you eradicate all corrosion and none of its causes remain.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And you should leave it for three days, and apply on the cauterized places a triple layer of oil mixed with scar tissue until all scars are totally eradicated and all corruption.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And you should take care to make powder from flesh-bearing roots.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days the flesh is born healthy in which there is no corruption, well; but if not, then repeat the cautery on that which remains corrupted in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corroding ulcer is treated with some old remedies of acute medicine, because that is half in place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But Emperor's cautery with fire is to add less juice of juniper.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have said the treatment of it with acute medicine in the division, and so take that when it is in its proper season.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the cauterization of wounds and other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many veins go to the lower parts of the foot afflicted with a wound called "clau", and it is a gross, festering cause which harms the foot; and cauteries are made in those places according to two manners, so it is cauterized with fire and cauterized with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	More cauteries are made at the point where it seems to ignite with a burning pain, which is made of iron according to the quantity that each part contains, and is of subtle margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then stop the ignition on the nail, and return your hand to the cautery in the circuit of the nail until the cautery penetrates to the depth of the nail.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave it like that for three days until you start to feel better gradually.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a poultice made with evil-smelling herbs and salt, and leave the poultice on it for a night, because that will eradicate its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place affected by generating new flesh until it is healthy.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and you have wounds opening on the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, then it is necessary that you administer those cauteries with water, and it is that you take a cannula of iron or of burning pain, and stop that on the nail; and then pour a little quantity of hot water, and return your hand, and you return that with compression of your hand from top to bottom, and it is implanted in the margin of the cannula at the root of the nail, and you will find the hot water flowing through the root of the nail; and wait for the patient a little while feeling the burning sensation of the hot water for an hour, and then remove that, because the nail with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus it is done in those places and then you proceed to the other until you overcome all the parts of their body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then heal those pus that the roots of the nails are eradicated, and with which the flesh will regenerate.

De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the cautery of trembling.

E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of it is relieved and the health of the patient is restored from the cold disease.

De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cautery of sudden accidents to the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When the body is suddenly afflicted, and pustules appear which are made of gross corrupted matter; therefore it is necessary at the beginning to appear, that it be cautered on every head of the fistula with a subtle cautery of myrtle wood, the extremity of which is extended in fire; or with a root of long erestology; or with a slow cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.
