And beware that you do not do what the ignorant barbers do in their foolishness and audacity about the extraction of theirs, lest they do not administer what we have recommended; for many evacuations come to the bad homes with great difficulties which are more difficult than those that are extracted, and the roots of theirs remain entirely, or some of those, or that you extract those from the osses of the mandible thus as many evacuations have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then the extraction of it is washed with the mouth in eight days or agreed upon salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if you find fluxes of blood for a while, thus as many evacuations find, then apply some quantity of wax and asperegys on the wound, and if it does not confer that wax, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and subtle holders which are used to extract the tooth at the beginning is of long extremity, short handle and large, so that they are not doubled when one has to operate with those.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And thus as many times of large handle until when you hold them in your hands they are not doubled, they are short extremities.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And there are made of Indian iron instruments with straight extremities, and in the extremities of those are teeth which ones enter into the others and hold for strong construction, and some evacuations have extremities like the beak of a bird called cicnia, so it is held, and they are of strong construction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter xxvi.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the extraction of teeth and dislocation of the bones of the injured mandibles.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to extract a tooth which is stuck for some reason, then it is necessary that you pause on the spot with a border for one day or two until the spot is mollified; and then insert the instrument or holders with extremities which are assembled like the beak of a bird called cicnia or guanta, in the form of forceps.
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The external limbs are similarly affected by cold humors that infiltrate them like lime or alum.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey your own judgment in these forceps or tenaculas, then it is necessary to operate on the affected area and dissect all the flesh and entrails, using an instrument called atali, which is a small lever whose shape is like this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And let the thick outer layer of skin be briefly and gently removed, and not be swollen so that it does not become constricted.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Then if the affected area is not opened up, well; and if not, help yourself with other instruments of which these are the forms: the form of the first instrument is a triangular-shaped external limb in which there is some thickness.
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it be triangular and have a more subtle external limb.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And thus you will be helped with this instrument having two ramps, of which this is the form suitable for the following.
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which precede in scraping of teeth; because juvenation is done with this instrument which is assembled to a large hook, and this is the form.
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular-shaped external limb curved or short, which has some thickness, and not be swollen so that it does not become constricted.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another thing you know is that the instruments for teeth are moved thus and similarly to the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	The skilled artisans are wise and subtle in their art, attentive to their materials according to what they signify, the operation and various illnesses; because they are among the illnesses that the ancients did not diagnose nor pause with their own instruments, for the forms of diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	Moreover if the bone of the jaw or other bones of the mouth are constricted, or if they are porous, then be careful about that in its place where it is convenient for the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of roots of teeth, and help yourself with gestures of which this is the form.
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let there be some small thickness gradually, and let it be tightened or held in the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until all the bone is opened up; and then restore the place with medicines conveniently adapted to that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Moreover if there is small porosity in the bone, then scrape that porosity and its blackness, and cure it until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the treatment of prominent teeth above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the teeth are prominent not according to their natural form, and especially when they protrude in women, and especially in venerable old men; therefore it is necessary that you consider: if a tooth is not attached to another tooth, and it is not possible to suture or ligament it, then root out that one; moreover if it is not annexed to another tooth, then you excavate that with this instrument of which this is the form; and it is similar to a boar's mouth, and make it sharp like Indian steel from the external pointed edge.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your excavation be in which you excavate that one in three days for the durability of the tooth, and that it not be joined to another of the teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is a prominent tooth exposed to lime, then lime that one with lime of Indian steel of which this is the form.
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it be all of Indian steel and sharp marguez; and let it be of many small points thus like lime on which they are made agulhas, on which the tooth is limed a little at a time in many days with facilitation, so that no other tooth is joined and falls out.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then file it away in the fig tree, and scrape that one with sharp razors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth of which one part is constricted and touches the tongue, then it is necessary that you file away that one until the aspersion of that fraction is stopped and enclosed, and let it be applied so that the tongue does not touch it nor the speech does not corrupt.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of teeth with gold or silver foil.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When concussion and removal occur through percussion or through falling, and the illness cannot be strengthened over what it affects, and you have treated that one with styptic medicines, and your cure has not been of value, then so that they do not fall out in those that are strengthened with gold foil and not silver, because silver turns greenish and is porous after several days, but gold at no time becomes muddy.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the gold foil be in such subtlety and thickness according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the form of the reception is that you take the gold foil and take its double between two healthy teeth, and then it grows with two tortuosity of the gold foil between two teeth, or if one or many, until it reaches the web of the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then iterate the process until the part of which you began, and strengthen your hand with facility and wisdom until it is not loose.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your constriction be the one that strengthens the veins of the teeth that do not decay.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then remove the superfluous fibers from the tooth with forceps or tongs, and add those to any place in the gesture, and convert them into occult between the healthy tooth and the decayed tooth, so that it does not cause lesion on the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	Then release that thus strayed cum Roman.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	Maybe it is dislocated or ruptured, strengthen it or them with another tooth in such a manner that it is entirely at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the correction of two healthy teeth and of two decayed, thus as it happens to these joined ones.
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it happens that one returns a tooth or two to their proper place, and they are re-attached thus as we have recommended, and they remain.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And do not make anything unless you are skilled artisans.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And some evacuated are apt for some cause of the cow's bones, and it is made from their form as a tooth, and it is placed in the place where the tooth failed, and it is strengthened thus as we have said, and it remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	About the incision of the ligament which you see in the tongue and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which you find below the tongue sometimes is or is naturally in the one that men use, or accidentally and suddenly due to a wound that has already consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on him is to open the mouth of the patient, his existing head being in the tie; and elevate the tongue, and then incise those nervous ligaments according to the latitude until the tongue is freed from its retention.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	Maybe there is some hardness or induration, and it has been steady for consolidation of the wound, then you make an incision and dissect according to the latitude until you have incised the ligament and the induration is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And beware that there is not made a fracture in the pincer of the flesh and that you dissect here with great care and avoid a flow of blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the remnants of the incision with warm water or with wine or with cool water; and then pause beneath the tongue, licking; thus it is customary to hold the patient beneath the tongue at some time so that another wound is not consolidated.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	Maybe there is an accident of blood flow, pause at the vitriolic place thrice; maybe if the blood comes, then cauterize the place with a gentle cautery that is convenient for this.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then that cure is for other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a ranula beneath the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes it happens that beneath the tongue an abscess forms, similar to a small tumor, preventing the tongue from its natural operation; and for this reason it is magnificent until it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on him is to open the patient's mouth in front of the light and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you find it is of dark color or black, hard, which the patient does not feel sensation, then do not touch that quartan crisis.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is declined to whiteness, in which there is humidity, then you put the onguent on him, and incise with a subtle spatula, and incise all around; and if blood comes out at the time of your operation, then you pause for three hours, thus it is vitriolic, until the blood is restrained.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work until you have treated it with a complement of him, until it is washed with warm water and salt; and cure that with another cure adapted to this until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the extraction of abscesses from two ears and of that which is nothing in the gullet and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When you find in the gullet a godat, so they are glands which are assembled together, which occur before and are called two ears, which when you cure them with what we have said in the division and it is not healed, then you consider if the abscess is hard, of dark color, of little sensation, then do not touch that with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of red color and the root is thick, then do not touch that with iron for the flow of blood; beforehand let it be until it matures, and then you can operate on it, or it will be broken for itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, radish, and the root of it is subtle, then that is what should be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on him is that you consider, during your operation, if it has already rested the abscess of his cautious remedy or if it has been diminished with some diminution; and then make the patient sit in front of the sun, and his head be in the tie, and open the mouth of him, and the servant takes between his hands before the tongue beneath with a noble instrument of which this is the form.
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	It should be made of silver or copper, and it should be subtle as a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then as you press with your tongue and it shows you the aposteme, and cut above that same tender spot, then take nine and place it in the amulet, and pull it to the parted areas as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing that you extract from the tunics, and then incise it with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is assembled with forceps, however the extremities of it are curved, thus that the orifice of each one of them is in the interior of the other, very pointed, which is of iron indeed inbuilt.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not at your disposal, then incise it with a spatula of which this is the form of it: It should be pointed on one side, not pointed on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have incised one vein, incise the other according to this same method of incision, and then apply the incision to the patient's gums with cold water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a flow of blood, apply cold water of decoction of sage or of mint leaves and similarly to that of the stopping causes until the flow of blood is restrained, and then cure it until it is healthy.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And some evacuated abscesses in the gulley other apostemes like those two golden veins, and incise them according to what you have said and dictated in the incision of two veins in a circle.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And you have already medicated a woman with an aposteme which was born in her gulley, the aposteme tended to a dark color, of little sensation, which had almost closed her gulley, and the woman breathed with great stricture, and had prohibited eating and drinking water, and was perverted unto death if she had stayed like that for one day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the aposteme had so much swelled that it had formed two ramps until they emptied through two conduits.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Then you carefully dissected it and placed it in one of their holes, and pulled it, and extracted from the large portion, and then you incised that which comprehended the other conduit, and then you opened the patient's mouth, and comprehended their tongue, and then you placed the hole in that aposteme.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then you removed a large part of it, and there did not flow from it except a little blood.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the gulley of that woman was absolutely free, and she began to drink water, and then took viands, then you did not cease to incise that aposteme much because it was prolonged for a long time, and the aposteme succeeded in its place, which incised until it was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then you healed it and cauterized the gulley of it, then thus of addiction; and then you walked and did not know that God did that miracle for me.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 38.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the incision of a hollow when it is apostematous.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the hollow is catarrhed, and it is apostematous and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is in the thick and round part, then it is called a bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is cured with that which we have said in the division, and it does not conform to your cure, and sometimes it happens that the aposteme remains hidden from it and is subtle, then it is necessary that you incise what is added round; and if it is at its length, and is bloody, of dark color or black, and it is not in its sentiment, then it is necessary that you make an incision of it, because there is fear about the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you sometimes do it according to the method that you have said of its whiteness and length, that you make the patient seize with your tongue and press with an instrument of which proceeds in its form and then places the hole in the new one, and pulls it down and incises it with one of two instruments which are said in the incision of two veins.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And it is necessary that you do not incise it unless it is adjusted according to the natural term of its addition, because if you incise more, you will let the blood flow out.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then the incision, use that which we have recommended in the incision of two veins, and cure it until it is healthy.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient was frightened by the incision of it, it is necessary that you use art in the cauterization of it with fear, and the method of cauterizing it is not only with sharp water, and it is that you place the head of the patient on the tender spot, and then press with your tongue with the instrument which we have said, and then take from the water which we have said in the chapter of cauterization, and conforms to that living cause, and pause it not sparse nor subtle, and fills the concavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	The extraction of the cavity where the medicine is placed, like a hollow cylinder of ray, and place the instrument in the medicine on the valve, and the patient spits over the shoulder cloth so that corrosive saliva or mucus from the mouth of that person does not obstruct the internal medicine, so that it does not impede the gullet of the patient.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then put your hand in the medicine, and express that onto the uvula for a space of half an hour until it becomes disinfected and soothed by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a thread and envelop it around the extremity of the ray, and submerge the thread in the medicine, and introduce the ray into the thread through a canal until the thread adheres to it, and do this many times until you obtain what you want from the cauterization of the uva, and then leave it so that it will cicatrize and fall off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to iterate the medicine, repeat it, and then apply the cauterization by burning in a circle on the uva with thread embedded in border, and notify that which is in the circuit of the patient's medicine, and wash it with cold water, and cure beforehand by embrocation, and remove the gargling symptoms until it is sanitized.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this species of cure is more salvific than incision and longer in duration.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some wounded eyes are cured with that which is more subtle than cauterization and incision, because it is cured by subfumigation in this manner: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all those causes, or some of theirs, into a bag, and let them steep in wine vinegar, and boil; and the bag should be well sealed, and place it in the middle of the bag a tube, upon which is placed an instrument made of silver or copper according to this manner; it is done with silver or copper.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And then introduce the extremity into the patient's mouth until the vapor reaches the uva through the pipe, so that the uva is not too obstructed.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then iterate over those many wounded places until it is dry, and beware that you do not make this cure at the commencement of the advent of apostemas, because it would too much adjust in the apostema, and do not think that you are doing that, but rather declare the apostema of the patient's caution.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	Maybe if you do not have this instrument present, then take a cane and compose it on the extremity of the patient's closed mouth, so that the patient's mouth is comforted, because the closure of the mouth prohibits the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of spines and that which adheres to the gullet and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many wounded places adhering to the gullet or spine of feet or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you will extract what is apparent from those, upon which the sight falls, because you take the tongue with an instrument alone in the sun, so that it may be declared to you what is in the gullet.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what does not appear and is hidden in the gullet, you will make the patient vomit by inducing that the food is digested in the stomach, because the cause annexed to the gullet will be forced out by vomiting; or give the patient a piece of nap or radish of lettuce or a dry loaf of bread; or take a piece of dried seaweed sponge, and tie it strongly with thread, and then pass the patient through that, so that as they spin and are extracted, then they will be forced out.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And maybe take an eel and bind it with strong thread, and place it on the table and afterwards it will be extracted; or take a porpoise and afterwards extract the intestines and afterwards extract the entrails.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	Maybe if you do not force out those causes which we have discussed, then use an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it is more gross than a small ray, and in the extremity of the patient's cavity which you introduce into their gullet with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And the old man raises his head to them, and beware that the touch of the old bones of the gullet, so that it does not injure the body or that which pierces the bone or spine, or that the doctor places his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	Maybe the emperor orders that the patient who introduces himself is freed, by his knowledge of the place of the annexed cause and pierces in them, and pulls his hand with the instrument on them, all according to the quantity which is prepared until it is forced out.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of blood congealed and annexed to the gullet.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When blood is treated with the aforementioned medicine in the division of the cure and not comforted, consider then the patient's language in the Golayro's soliloquy, since you have comprehended the tongue of the instrument that you have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the blood treatment, extract it with a small knife or subtly handle it with delicate gestures.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract it, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's soliloquy, and place a fiery iron in the cavity of the cannula, and make as many turns (until the blood treatment is dead and removed from the soliloquy) and abstain from the patient for the entire day of water.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a full vessel of cold water, and put the patient's mouth in it, and wash their mouth with it; and do not transgress from that cause and mix the water for an hour, then another on their hand, because the blood treatment is just as sensitive to the cold water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	Moreover, if it is not forgotten what you have recommended, then suffumigate the patient with cumin or asafoetida through the instrument that you have recommended in the suffumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do it, because it is four times a year.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And it is another manner of operation in the suffumigation of that, which is to take a pipe on which are ignited carbonized coals and the pipe is covered with a cover in the middle of which is a tube; and then descend under the suffumigation; and place the patient's mouth at the end of the cannula, and close their mouth so that the suffumigation is not forgotten until you know that the suffumigation has reached the blood treatment, because the blood treatment is changed four times.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not work, then repeat the suffumigation many times, and abstain from the patient's drinking, and eat salty foods and soups, and do not drink water, and thus it is necessary that this regimen should not be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the shape of the instrument with which the blood treatment of the soliloquy is treated when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps, but not because it is in some curved shape:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed on the soliloquy, and its extremity is similar to a beak of a stork, which is guarded, in which is sharpened with a file, so that, when you comprehend some cause, it does not leave.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the sermon in perception of abscesses and in section of theirs.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The abscesses are many special kinds, of many manners, according to the memory of them, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in perforation and section of theirs for two manners, one of which is for the species of abscesses in their measures; and for that which you comprehend of the humidities.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second manner is proper to the places in which accidents of the body occur, because the abscess that occurs on the head is different from the abscess that occurs on the buttocks; and the abscess in the carnal place occurs differently from the abscess that occurs in a joint; and each one of them has its judgment for operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And many abscesses are such that they cover that they are not perforated but rather matured by the sania in those or complete them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other abscesses cover that they are wounded when they are crossed, and they do not mature according to their compliment, just like abscesses that are proper to the joints, because an abscess when it has a joint, its essence is prolonged until it can pour out what is in its circuit, and strongly corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, so that it is a cause of contraction of that member; or it is an abscess proper to a principal member, and if you delay the perforation of it until it matures, you will not harm the principal member; or it is proper to the buttocks, therefore perforate what has not matured, and do not cover that they perforate crudely, from incomplete digestion, but rather that which is proper to the buttocks, so that you do not pour out its essence and it is elongated to the divided parts of the buttocks, and it is a fistula, or it is done in the term of it that it is not healthy.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	Many cover that you know the time of the perforation of the abscess, and thus it is when it matures.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you know that it is matured when there is the cessation of pain and the ceasing of fever, and then the diminution of the rigor and of the pulse, and the acuity of the head of the abscess, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because you cover that you know the perforation will occur in the place where the pus is beneath the abscess and where the pus comes from the cure of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And perforation is sometimes through the length of the flesh or of the body, if the abscesses are in the parts of the hands or feet, and in the place of the ligaments, of the cords of the nerves, of the arteries; and, afterwards, in all places where there is no reflection; because in those that do reflect, use perforation according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	When the aposteme is in a fleshy location, it is advisable to delay perforation until it is confirmed that digestion is taking place according to the usual process, as we have previously stated; for if you perforate at that time, it will prolong the body of the patient's disease and make his lips ulcerous and the depth of the wound more putrid.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	Sometimes apostemes are perforated according to the latitude of the flesh or the condition of the body, or according to the necessity of which the affected member indicates.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And it is necessary to administer small perforations, and in large apostemes a great and wide perforation or multiple sections according to the diversity of the size of the apostemes.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And other times of the apostemes in which it is necessary that the coding be overcome and be enclosed, when it is done thus, it will be in a term that already exists, just like one who accumulates in drops of dubellum and of bubbles.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised in a section having three angles; and of those that are incised thus like the figure of a leaf of myrtle, just like the apostemes of the veins.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of theirs in which a round section is administered and a lunar section, and they resemble those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	Sometimes that which cannot be seized thus like the superficial apostemes of lions, it is necessary to perforate with a superficial perforation, or to plane only on the surface.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And it is necessary when the aposteme is large and has collected much sania, that you perforate it and do not think to extract all the pus at that hour; having extracted a part of it, and then you apply oil to the aposteme until another day, and then you extract a larger part, and then you make many evacuations according to gradation until it is fully purged.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And it is especially so if the patient is of frail virtue, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or an elderly person in decline, because the animal spirit is much resolved to expel the sania, and it will quickly kill the patient, and you will operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Be careful in this chapter with great caution, and then make your perforation in which you perforate these apostemes, because you will cleanse the wounds and consider therefore if the wound of the aposteme is small, or it is a flat section, then you will administer the remedies of oil or of anti-irritant coto; and if the aposteme is large, and the fissures of the perforation are many, then it is necessary that you pause in some tract until they come to an end.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the aposteme a part of the coding is abscessed or has concaved into the circuit, then it is necessary that you complete it with anti-irritant coto oil or with a thread of drap from flax, just like when you have treated pans or razizos, with humidity; and strengthen it until the third day; and then proceed to cure what is necessary to remove the engorgements until it is sanitized.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	Sometimes if there is a flow of blood during the time of your operation, then you administer cold water and wine in which you mix a thread of flax, and pause that over the location of the blood flow, many evacuations.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	Sometimes if the blood flow persists, then it is necessary that you administer a regimen and cure, and powder with those that have been recommended in many places of our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	Sometimes if it is in winter time, and the location of the aposteme is a location of many nerves, then it is necessary that you apply poultices with wine and oil, and pause those over the locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the locations are fleshy, then it is necessary that you pause poultices wrapped in water and oil or wine and oil, and all that should be cool until the third day, as we have said, and then it is necessary that you dislodge the aposteme and cleanse it and administer the cure of what is convenient to it until it is sanitized.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus it is necessary to know the cure of apostemes universally, sometimes according to the way of distinction already said about each aposteme in which manner it is the way of curing it by chapters separately.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the section of apostemes which come in the coding of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the coding of the small head, little apostemes, and so of species of nodes which contain tunics that are at their fact; and the species of theirs are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they are pungent, and of those that contain humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those that contain humidity similar to pores, and they resemble them; and of those that are lapideous, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of everything, and in the extraction of those that are not fearful, as one must extract those that do not cause contradictory archeria.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you spread them with an instrument in the form of which you approach thus, which is called entromes, until you know what they contain.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Because if there is moisture that retains humidity, then separate it with a dry cloth according to the length for superficial separation in this manner:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	It begins at the separation of the line of B, entering to the line of G. Then, when the humidity is evacuated, then you excoriate that skin which contains that humidity, and do not leave any of those causes of total, because many weakened returns, if it remains from some cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then submerge it in Egyptian ink, if it is present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill that plague and let it enter another day, because I corrode everything so that it removes all from that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then iterate over that spot with Egyptian ink again and thirdly if it is indicated for him, until you are confident that there is no remaining cause of that skin; then cure the plague with Egyptian ink until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess contains fatty nodes, then you incise it according to this method:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	It has the form of a cross, and cut between the two lips of the incision and scrape everything from that entire partition, and extract your virtue in extraction of the tunic which contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	Perhaps if you have made a mistake, then do the opposite, so that you can rectify it primarily.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the lapified abscess of incision and cure according to what you have said; and incision over the lapified abscess is less grievous, because it is of little blood and little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And some old women know about these abscesses which are on the head of some men who have none of that humidity; which causes it because you have incised over an abscess on the head of an old woman and touched the abscess thus with a rough, harsh, white, which could not be pierced, and if someone has touched that percussion, it would plague.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	Perhaps in the other accidental abscesses on the head there is not this capital, thus like the abscesses that come to the heads of children and devour the roots of the ears, but the incision of all these should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And stop the perforation of those parts from the lower part of their skin, so that the body of the wound is alleviated at the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then heal those things with what is convenient for that cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofula which occur on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many weakened returns are caused by these abscesses on the neck and in the axillae and in the joints; and some weakened returns occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur on the neck, and many that are generated between them, and all scrofula of those is within its own proper tunic, and thus like in the nodes and abscesses of the head, thus as we have recommended.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrofula are many, because some of them are lapified, and some contain humidity, and some are malignant which do not obey cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Then in that one which you find with good disposition in the Tocament, of which the color of that which is manifest is similar to the color of the codena, and it is mauled throughout the entire part, and it is not annexed to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and it is not preoccupied, because you incise it with superficial incision from above the part down to the line of G., entering the line of B., and scrape that entire part, and extend two lips of the codena on one side, or many sides if there is need of those, thus as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more caution that neither the vein nor nerve should be incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And it is more careful that you do not adjust your hand in incision, or quiet the patient, and that you incise what is not necessary to incise; because if you incised a vein or artery and prohibited yourself from your operation, then pause in the vetriol plaster or other powders which stop the flow of blood, and strengthen the plague, and let it enter until it repauses the acuity of the abscess and mollifies the plague and begins to be puerperal.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is absorbed.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then investigate if there is some cause of the other small scrofula, so incise them and cleanse them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the large scrofula vein, because then you should not incise that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Besides, because it seems that you have made a double strong faith and leave it until it falls by itself without being noticed.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound of the cut thigh which you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment, and take care to cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise that entire scab, then be sure to adjust the two lips of the wound and cauterize as much as possible so that no excess flesh remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	Perhaps you see that excess flesh has remained due to the greatness of the scab, be sure to understand how to incise the root of it, and separate it and administer a suture, and that is what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And in those scabs that contain humidity, make a superficial perforation here at the place of maturation of it, and stop the perforation of what you see is the pus at the bottom of the ulcer, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer perforation, with warm ointments and similarly to those, so that it corrodes what remains of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound is already cleaned, then take care to apply an ointment of generating flesh inside so that it may be healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	About the section of the pillow of the accidental aposteme next to the goulard.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	They dislodged these abscesses from this section in the pillowy swelling, and we did not see anyone in our land who had made it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the sermon about those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	Perhaps in the men who have had an accident, be sure that the extraction of the pillowy swelling is avoided, because for that reason it will not be made quickly, so that all the veins and major parts of the thigh are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	Perhaps in those who have abscesses burst in the mouth or goulard or two aurelia, when the badness is not in the cane, be sure to use the section of pillowy swelling to flee from the loss which is made by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Then be sure when we want that, to incise the pillowy swelling beneath three circles of the circles of the pillowy swelling, or four with a small section for the latitude in what is between two circles by quantity, so that the section is in cipher, not in the cartilage, and this place is convenient for section, because it is deprived of flesh and the vessels of the blood which are there.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is inexperienced, then be sure that he extends the cord of the goulard with an onion, and then inserts the cord inside so that it reaches the canal, perhaps to avoid the blood vessels if you see them because of some other cause.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incise the cleft according to what we have recommended; and it is significant about the section of the canal for the relaxation of what is of that excess matter which is of the disrupted and for the abortion of the void.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And then the wound will be open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Then when the hour is renewed in which the perforation is tempered, add two lips of the cord of the wound, and sew that alone to the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that make the flesh grow inside so that it may be healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of the sermon which we have recommended, exposition is not but that you see that some of these apostemes have already pillowy-swollen the goulard of the thigh, and the thigh has come to death, and its wing is between- cut, and some go to incise the epiglottis so that the thigh may breathe on the place of the wound for some respiration, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for that reason I command to leave the wound open until the evil of the badness is consumed; and it is the evil of it for three days; and then I command thus the wound, and take care of it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen through my metaphors, is that a servant held a knife and put it in the goulard of his thigh and incised with one part of the cane of the lung, and I was called to the healing of it, and I buried the mungent thus as it is buried by the dead, and discovered the wound and buried the blood which was issuing from the small wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Then I must confess that it had not incised a vein nor guided, and the wind was issuing from the wound, and I took care of it until it was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And do not accuse the servant if he does not return to the void, and then some days returned to the administration of their own dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the pillowy swelling there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	About the section on the abscess that occurs in the goulard beforehand, and it is called hernia of the goulard.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess named hernia of the goulard is a great abscess according to the color of the body, and it is more in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is according to two manners, because either it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural one, it is not necessary to cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	The accident is caused by two manifold forms of which one resembles swollen nodes, and the other form resembles an abscess made by arterial node inflammation, and in that there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And it does not cover the surface of the tumor with iron except in one that is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe that and investigate with the aforementioned, and if you find it resembles swollen nodes, and it is not suspended from any of the veins, then you incise thus with the nodes, and extract what contains the pus and serum; and otherwise, then the entire tissue is scrutinized, and you carefully cure the area that requires healing until it is healthy.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the section of species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the nodes, there are many species and I have already said all the species of theirs in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it covers how I recommend distinguishing the difference between a node and an abscess with surface doubtfulness.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore I say that an abscess is heat and fever and violent pains until the inflammation of the excess is reduced; and it is a complete putrid decay that when it ceases, the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a node is not heat nor fever nor pain, and it contains that thick cloudy liquid which is in its own proper sac.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a boil and it is made thus as a vacuum, whether major or minor, and they are according to two species, whether they are fat or contain humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, as I have said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore it covers, when you approach the cure of a node, that you expose and inquire into its beginning with instrumental stirring which is called introgression, according to how you will find its form in the chapter that is apropos to this.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the manner of inquiry into abscesses and all nodes, and it is that you take this instrument and introduce it into the humid place which you find in the abscess, and you rotate the threads little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated to the bottom.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And finally you place your hand according to the measure of the greatness of the abscess, and finally extract the introgression and consider what is left in the remnants of it.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the current humidity is forgotten, of whatever color it may be, then you incise on the surface section according to what I have said about other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if in the remnants of the introgression there is no humidity, then you know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And cut above it with a crosswise incision having the form of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.
