Sometimes it is necessary to provoke evacuation for illness or for continuity, administer that at every hour at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle place of it and at some time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz. E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And be careful, if it is necessary, iteration of leeches, when it is possible to move them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are forbidden from suspension, then cool the affected area with fresh blood or stick a needle in the areas until blood is obtained; and afterwards place them, for they sense some blood as soon as they adhere.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall off, powder on them a little of thrice-tried aloes, or salt, or cinder, and it will happen soon.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and it is restoration of fracture and accidental dislocation in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that many foolish doctors and the common people and those who for a long time did not regard the books of the Ancients nor read a letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is made that this manner of the scientists in our land is private; and I have not found anything in any time to be complete; and no one has admitted what comes after, except through the length of reading the books of the Ancients and study on the understanding of them, until they extract the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I direct my effort and study to the length of my own life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that contains my science and about which I have passed my own experiment; since here I have abbreviated it for you others and delivered it from the occupation of prolongation; and I have abbreviated it at the end of abbreviation; and I show it at the end of declaration; and I form it into many forms of the instruments that are administered in it, as is done by addition of declaration, thus as I have done in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections of bone fractures, from which the necessary precautions are, before we begin the remembrance of fractured members and diverse ones, if singular.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	I will therefore outline in the prohemium of this chapter the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters for the understanding of those which from the beginning are foreseen by the craftsmen and established on the truth of them; so it is you and those who are prompt that know or learn this noble art besides you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when accidents occur due to fracture or dislocation or twisting or falling, then it is necessary that you take care at the beginning with fleshbotomy or alleviating that, or whatever steps, if no cause prohibits, thus as debilitation of virtue, or it is that which occurs suddenly, or old age in decrepitude, or it is a time of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then be content with a diet of fresh herbs and of meats of birds and of crustaceans; and prohibit gross meats and fill up on diets and all diet that fills the veins with blood, until you are secure from apostemic caution, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their primary regimen, in which they were accustomed to before.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And then since the broken bone begins to be restored, then it is necessary that the patient be fed with nutritious diets of subtle and gross nourishment, thus as their diets are made from wheat flour cooked in water, and rice, and cabbage, and fish, and beef, and fresh fruits, and gross and similar ones, and at this regimen is made coagulation of fracture by gentle and moderate treatment.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you know that the brittle bones, when they are in the old people who are in the first weakness and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they be continued and consolidated according to their nature by the desiccation of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature for all time by the desiccation of those members, and they continue and consolidate those that are of theirs at the end of the lentitude, thus as the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	The supreme nature adjusts and connects above the broken bone of all parties any similar cause like glue in which it is grossly strengthened that adheres and strengthens until they are conglutinated and tied together, until they come to the end of fortitude and firmness, thus as a focus at the beginning, until no cause prohibits them from their own works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary to pause the veins of the patient, veins in which there is gravity and viscosity and grossness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many varieties of fracture according to variety of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And we know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the variety of the limbs, because a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and a fracture of the bone of the foot is different from a fracture of the bone of the back; and similarly all the other limbs are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I will come to a remembrance of each species of fracture, explained in a distinct chapter separate from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many varieties of fracture in the same bone.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fracture in the bone are diversified among themselves; because there is an arched fracture which occurs on the stars; and some veiled ones are made with a fracture according to the length of the bone: and so the fractures of the sagittal and stellar and proceeding and not-proceeding, as it is done in the pain when it is prepared to write, and it is a fracture with plague and disruption in the head, and it is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to each species belongs a proper torment in the restoration of it according to what will come to remembrance of it distinctly in its own places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many signs of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by which is known a fracture of the bone: it is the twisting of it, and the eminence and appearance of it to the feeling, and thus of it when it is comprehended by your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is no apparent twisting in the place, nor does it feel like a touch when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not experience great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, it is possible that there is twisting or small fissure, so much that you cannot feel it with your hand and with total compression; however, pause over the bone of the medicines which I will recall at that moment what is convenient for the place; and therefore strive for a subtle strictness.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And we know that the place where it is arched and not divided into two or another thing which does not occur in the sagittal, as it is entirely dislocated from its own comparison, then it is clear that you begin from your hour to rectification of it, because at that point it will reach apostema caution.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it reaches apostema caution, then let it be for some days until the apostema ceases; and therefore I will bind it according to whatever method you can of elevation and of ingeniosity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And we know that restoration of it and reduction of it is more difficult than the bone in which it occurs, especially in the sagittal.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And therefore I will strengthen it according to what will come to remembrance of it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is sagittal, then it is necessary to extend this broken member into two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two cords or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And it is your position in which you pause the member in its natural figure, while the extended parts of the broken member, then you perform that they return to their ingenious and natural place, according to whatever method you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And beware according to your strength that you do not fall on the patient during your operation, nor cause harm; and perform according to your own power that you apply one bone to another as a companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is clear that at that hour you profitably touch with your hand, and if sometimes there is some diverse cause, rectify it and bind it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, as many foolish doctors do, who cause apostema caution through their operation, or cause contraction in the member, as we have seen that through the operation of many foolish doctors.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And therefore I connect, I equalize and perform decent operation and structuring of that member, and repose and tranquility; I admonish the patient about it and make them avoid that in the hour of their vigils and of their sleep, and see their revolution and agitation, and give their ejection, and give all their movements with all their virtue; and beware that the position of the member is a position in which the pain is assured, which causes because when sent to the disposition of the position of the broken or wounded member; then it is clear that you permute it to another disposition of it in which there is no pain; and look at it so that the position of it is direct and equal, so that the member does not twist when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the structure of the tranquil member is that which I recommend; because we know that broken members are diversified in their smallness and greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small, such as the arm and the finger and the vein, and similar to those, then it is clear that the envelopment should be with a very subtle drap.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	Those who have large thighs like a cushion or chest, it is said that in them there is involved a hard and lasting connection, because the ligament connects the large member strongly and equally in all parts, so that in it no stain enters.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, make your evacuation of equity, place a convenient ligament on the water, above the area of that fracture in three or four wraps according to the member's merit; and strengthen your hand with a small ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then see that it goes to the affected part above the area of the fracture, and strengthen mind that you do not force your structure on the one that has strengthened the area of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then extend yourself to the wrapping of the area of the fracture a little, and soften the small structure little by little, until you take hold of the area with a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap the other wounded area above the wrapping of the threefold area, and then see that the wrappings are on the affected part below the fracture; and be your operation in the structure of the wrapping and in softening according to what we have said in the primary wrapping from above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the layers of the wrapping to stop the inflammation or swelling where the twisting of the fracture is engaged, if it is twisted; and if not, do not pause for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause on the other bandage, and then engage on these wrappings decently made so far, if in the area there is no inflammation or apostema to beware of, and then pause on the water that sits on the apostema and removes the inflammation; and let it be for several days; and then you strengthen on the same wrappings.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the wrappings of the mixture of cannabis and lead root, be formed wisely; or of the wood of pine; or of strips of palm; and let each wrapping be according to this form and figure.
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is fitting that the wrapping which is placed on that fracture be thicker and longer a little than the other wrappings, and the length of the strip according to what is measured on the member in magnitude and smallness; and then strengthen on the wrappings with another bandage according to your primary structure; and then tie from below decently as we have said about structure, and it is that your structure be according to the area of the fracture itself, and when it is more distanced from the fracture, it lessens the structure.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it is fitting that the threads be medium in thickness and subtlety, and of soft wool; and if the threads are too thick, thus as you have seen through the operation of several foolish pauses, entwining the threads of the cord of the tort, and it is a great error, when you cut the structure without equality.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And excessively thin threads are not so convenient, because you do not conserve the structure for the water that you want, and it is not fitting that between wrapping and wrapping there be less than a digit.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is led by the extremities of the wrappings to the structure in those places, then pause below those that stop inflammation or burning heat until it does not make a lesion.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some wounded fractures are a plague, and they cause disruption in the code, and you will find remembrance in that chapter according to singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you know that all torn members are not straightened with wrappings on the first day; which causes it because the member, when it is large, does not fit to pause on the wrappings unless for five or seven days or more, according to your secure expectation of the arrival of apostema beware.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the implanters in which the Ancients restored, those who were placed on fracture and dislocation and torsion.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of implantation as an abbreviation of restoration of fracture, convenient for complex movements and majorment to the veins and joints, because it is about that on which there comes no heat nor cold: and it is that you take dust from the mill, and it is the marrow of the farina that gives movement to the mill in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And you find that thus as it is, except that you gather it in an album of skin, and pause the complexation of the non-spaced or subtle; and then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another manner of restoring fractures and dislocations: recipe of assafetida, lapdanum, acacia, enula, and migrach, which is made from millet grains salvage, one drachm; of myrrh and aloes one drachm; alochil one drachm and twenty; all are mixed and stirred together with water or album of honey if the complexion of the patient is cold; and then use this restoration, because it is of good composition and restores the broken bones moderately, and confers a lot of comfort.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another manner of restoring which confers on a fracture and twist: recipe of migrach and white altaea one drachm; of myrrh and aloes one drachm five; of acacia one drachm six; of Armenian boil one drachm twenty.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All grind to mortar at the same time, and crush well, and mix in water or in white album of egg and it shall be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Manual of setting bones for joints and separated osses from their places, and then accidental pain in those and in fissures and fractures: take a woolen thread and submerge it in warm oil and cut it and place it on the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Moreover, in this setting, there is not virtue of restoration, but rather a cautious expulsion of pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another manual of setting that restores broken bones: take fig leaves of a sweet sort and poppy leaves preserved; mix all together and make an emplacement of them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Manual of setting abbreviated administered for the restoration of bone fracture and when you want resolution of the remaining aposteme: take root of clay, of chamomile and violet flowers, of barley flour, all together in a partition. Grind all together and mix in wine, if the member is not scaled.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	Moreover, if it is scaled, then make a compress with water of sweet marjoram or with water and use it thus.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another manual of setting strongly resolves that this first, when apostemes harden for the restoration of the member: take root of clay and of hemp seeds, and of balsam, and melilot, majoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all together in a partition; grind all together and mix in water of sage or in water twice distilled or in wine, all according to the quality of the member and the repair of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Moreover, Hippocrates does not disagree in the free text that it should be placed on the member trembling for its restoration, but rather a mixture of wax and oil and no other cause; and recommends that it be balanced between thickness and subtlety.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	Moreover, Gualia has seen that it should be placed on the broken member for its restoration and the causes in which there is exsiccation of little heat, thus also with myrrh, and similarly to those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Manual of setting that comforts lesion and pain: take migat, of cedars, of inner skin of a wild man or pennyroyal, and of clay, and salt, mixed together; grind all together and crush well and mix, and make an emplacement.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	Moreover, the quantity according to which one covers the wound and it is dislocated, is that you consider if there is no pain nor swelling nor the bone is broken nor moved from its place, then you do not delay for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is a violently painful place or swelling or inflammation, then you should touch or delay it at that hour, and remove the setting from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a draught of lion's humour and marine sponge, and submerge it in warm water, and with that wash the place until the swelling and pain are calmed; and then let it rest for an hour; and then place on it a woolen thread submerged in warm oil or rose oil, and bind it around for a night until you are certain of cautious aposteme, and that it has repaired the inflammation of the member, and the pain is alleviated.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that subtle structure and small setting, and do not strongly bind with your primary construction, but rather subtly until it is healthy.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if at times the aposteme and roughness and pain and inflammation and all accidents are so completely removed, and you have need of setting and structure, then apply that thus as you have begun the entire treatment from the start.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there does not occur to the member any of those causes that we have mentioned, then do not delay it except for three days or four or five. and some wet applications all together are left on for 20 days according to what appears to you for the dislocation of the member, thus as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and it approaches the coagulation of the flesh over that.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust in the structure more than in your primary structure entirely, and assist in the thickening of the food of the patient, according to what is preceded by the remembrance of it.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	Moreover, if you find the place of the fracture is dry and thin more than it should not cover, then you know that nourishment is prohibited from arriving at that; and therefore embrocate it with warm water throughout all the wet applications that delay it; and it is in all three days; and loosen the structure a little, and by this operation correct the member's nourishment, and it is healthy gradually.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	More than it is customary to make the restorative remedies for a fractured limb otherwise treated when not initially restored, according to which they converge, and it is restored according to twisting, it is an error according to the operation of theirs, and great fear, and if it were to increase the ancient liberties and gain control over what has been done.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And you have not seen any of theirs that it does far, because it is more reasonable that it does not do so.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter according to: Of the fracture which occurs at the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and the causes are distinct, because some fractures are made by percussion of a bone, and the percussion occupies all the bone within the cipher, which is beneath the bone, thus as if it were in the fist, and for this reason this species is named ascial; or the bone breaks into some part of itself, and breaks the flesh around it and does not pass beyond the rear of it; and this species of fracture is named absolute levation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two fractures is great or small, and of fracture that is contraction or attraction; and the cause of it is percussion with a heavy or falling object on stone, and its signs are similar.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating that already approaches the peritoneum which is beneath the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the plague of these two fractures is great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of fracture it is that which is diminished in the bone, in the subtlety of the small hair, and for this reason this species of fracture is named capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that is made or by falling or by percussion of stone and its signs are similar, which makes some layer of the bone enter the divided parts, and it is made in the concave location thus as it occurs at the edges of the erema when it occurs at their percussion and it is part of their entrance into the divided parts.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And mostly it is made in the bodies of humid bones, thus as they are hollow and empty.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these species of fractures are saturnine, so they are pesky thus as separated stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And you will find the remedy for all this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I will reveal all these species of fracture by detection over those and by inquiry into their tender and ostentation of corrupted flesh that is above them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary species is recognized by this that it is discovered above the bone, and it is cleared, and limited to its tender part, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	More in the cure of fracture consider at the beginning the accidents of the malady, and then if you times for the accidents that signify by manifest significance on fear, thus as it is vomit of cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and absence of vote, and syncope, and acute fever, and settlement of the veins and rigor of those, and similar to their accidents in the major dispositions, they are not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you find non-concurrent accidents you hope for health, then you begin the cure of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause is because if it has come to you the plague at the beginning as it is a plague and it is in the days of winter, then it converges that you study in the osteament of the bone within the 14th day according to all disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then it converges that you touch or starve the bone within the 7th day, having that which is beneath the bone be corrupted by the peritoneum, and that the accidents we have recounted happen.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has reached the peritoneum covering the brain, and it is among divided parts and attraction, then it converges that you insert the comminuted and attractive part, according to what you have recounted to yourself.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you raise the head of the malady plague, and discover above the bone according to custom and manner possible for you according to the figure of the plague, and that it be lighter above the malady.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it occurs to you to make the detection of the bone, either blood or aposteme caut, then you oppose yourself to what converges, and it is that you fill the place of draps infused with wine and rose oil, and make repose the plague until it be sedated by the aposteme, and be sure of the flow of blood; and then begin in the circulation of the bone and in its ablation.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And that is according to one of two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one manner is that you insert the bone with an instrument of straight talent, and this is its form: And then administer another instrument like this, a little wider later than that; and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer more instruments wider than the one mentioned.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it converges that you have the name of diverse instruments, some of which are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than others and are in the rear of the acute extremities, and are of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use of their arm has facilitated percussion on the affected area so that it does not touch the head and lead to that.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	If the bone is strong and hard, then you should perforate in the circle of their teeth while administering the affected areas with non-deep probes.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And it is not called thus, but rather because those do not touch the term of the bone of the head to that which is near them, so that the round extremity or margin above that which is beneath the head appears like a margin or small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passes the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take many of these probes which almost converge at the thickness of each bone, so that they are present in all tests of the brain the extremity of which is acute, and the quantity in length and breadth is according to the quantity of thickness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of probes: The quality of perforating in the circle of the broken bone is that it pauses the probe on the bone and revolves it with the fingers until you know that the bone has been penetrated; and then pierce the probe to another place, and pause there where it is throughout the quantity of the thickness of the radius or environment.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then you insert the probes into the affected areas that are between each part of the bone, and make a subtle pus that you place on it in the end of levitation, as we have said, so that you radiate the bone, or with your hand, or for some other cause to stir up the instruments which will be prepared for it, as we have said, and with subtle forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And take care that you keep the probe with total caution so that it does not touch any part of the cranium.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And thus you will have circled the perforated bone, and it will be separated from the cranium if it is continued in it, and you will have extracted it, take care that you scrape and equalize it in the roughness of that which is in the bone with another instrument similar to a probe, but rather take care that it is a subtle pus and more subtle than the other probes.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if you remove some small parts of the bones and cartilages, then take that which is facilitated in that which is due to you from the instruments; and then cure the wound with ointments and unguents which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another manner of operation is gentle, far from pain, which Galen and the expert say is for great relief; and this is its sermon: it is necessary for you at the beginning that you begin to discover the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most violent and most manifest, so that when you have discovered that part and placed beneath it the gentle and light extremity of this probe, this is the form.
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And it is that the lenticular part is gentle and does not touch any cause, and the acute part is of it in two layers ahead in length, as we have said; that the lenticular part be adjusted to the cranium on the face of the incident acute bone.

Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor. And take care that you administer in your reason where it radiates the bone at the beginning of the most latent of those razors, and then use the most subtle part of it, and do not cease to do so according to continuity until you reach administering the most subtle and thinnest parts of all those.

Moreover, in some of the other small capillary fractures and subtle fractures, take care that you administer cure according to what you perceive as the goal of rectification of it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is a cause that is not diminished over all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And thus about what we have written, we have shown in great fractures.

And that medicine should be administered for one or two days before being certain of apostema's caution; and then remove it and administer medicines which are excessively drying, thus as a mixture of linseed and farina of bitter herbs, and powder of ginger and aristology, and resembling those.

It is that you make powders of these medicines which are powdered over the wound, thus as they are dry; and universally, administer all this proprietary medicine of which it is that it cleanses and does not bite.
