Many are recent contraction and node, then it occurs that they are embrocated with warm water in which they collect softening herbs, thus as they are fuels of high degree and roots of it, and melilot, and similar to those; and it is done in the emplaster with mollifying emplastering thus as it was well done; or that it is taken with mucilage of root of high degree and is continued in gray of guala or in oil of cirami, and is emplastered in that; or that they are taken with fat figures and are treated in women's colons, and similar to those of the medicines that are named as consolidating remedies.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And some wounds are dissolved in assiduous friction, which is in the most humid places, and movement of the member is administered at all times and in all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	Many are twisted and have gone downhill and are made strong and converted into stone and provoked necessity for cure with iron, then it occurs that the pus is removed from above and the continuation of the bone is dissolved, and something superfluous of node of that meter is inserted in the bone with subtle incisions, and is administered facility in that which is solicited and studied.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	On sermon about dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is a displacement of one of the joints from their natural place, because it is prohibited from movement, and the figure of the member is distorted, and brings about great pains and lesions to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, it is necessary to perform reduction as soon as possible, and not delay that reduction, because if it is delayed, the place becomes inflamed and strong with what is done, making difficult the reduction of the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason it does not occur that it is manipulated or stretched at the time of inflammation, because many vigorous movements bring about spasm and intense pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	Many times when this occurs, then it happens that you are led to the flattering of the patient, and then it is laid down until the inflammation subsides; and then the member is embrocated with warm water and oil, and then it is reduced with facility.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the whole member is cured with that of which the remembrance will come to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have now ordered the chapters of dislocation according to what is preceding in fracture; from the part of the body above down to the part below.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the cure of dislocation of the lower jawbone.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	Thus the two jawbones are dislocated if not straight; and the dislocation of both is done according to one of two methods: either they are removed from their places with little movement, and are softened a little; or they are completely dislocated and completed, until they are softened at the joint until the patient's saliva corrodes and cannot hold it nor close its mouth, and the tongue is enveloped in its speech.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	Many times when the dislocation of it is slight, then in the major arrangements it returns to itself for a slight cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	Many times when the dislocation is complete and entire, then it occurs that reduction of it should be administered quickly, and not delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister holds the patient's head, and inserts his fingers into one of their jaws in the region of the dislocation of the jawbone inside their mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or he inserts both fingers into both jaws simultaneously, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other fingers of his hands are beforehand positioned where they can hold; and he orders the patient to relax their jaws and release any tension from some quarter; and the doctor holds the jaw and presses it back into place until it returns to its proper position.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, and especially if both jaws are dislocated at the same time, then administer evaporative water with oil, so that it helps to ease the reduction of both and does not delay the reduction of both entirely, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And then when they are returned and in their place, and the patient's mouth is closed and not relaxed, then pause on those pillows of drape with cerote, and make it smooth with wax and oil rosat; and thus it will be easier to facilitate the limbs' movements.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on their back, with their head steady between two pillows, so that they do not incline to the right or left side; and do not force them into any position; having eaten a light meal, forbid them to eat for a while, until when the pains are relieved and the jaws are numb, then let them eat what they want.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this is administered to facilitate, and do not bother about the perception of the mouth unless eating and drinking and ocitation, until the jaw is numb and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of both jaws is difficult when they are dislocated at any time and not converted to their proper places, then apply heated cups and soda ashes, and strongly rub the patient's belly, and strongly induce vomiting with pure coleric medicine.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see that, then know that it is pernicious; and apply heated cups more to the one to whom it happens in ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the ankle and of the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The ankle is not dislocated from its joint inside the foot through its continuity; and sometimes it is dislocated to the front part beforehand, and that is declared by the sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is when the patient lies on their back and extends their arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then bind the area with your palm in strong binding, so that it returns to its place.

But the extremity of one who has a hernia and its continuation with it, is not dislocated on any day; then it is necessary that it be reduced and put in place according to what we have said and according to your apparatus.

E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And in this medical treatment, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its proper place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated to the upper part towards the lower part.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated to the upper part of the muscle, and that is done with tension; and it is not dislocated to the back parts through the shoulder; and it is not dislocated to the front parts through the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And especially it is dislocated and beforehand exits to the lower parts because of the titillic, and especially in those in which the flesh is sparse, it is easily dislocated; but in those in which there are many flesh, it is exited with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And strongly strike some men with percussion or cauterization, and the patient's muscle is affected by a cautious abscess, and it is cured because it has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then it is necessary that you proceed with this until you are certain of its condition, and then you will proceed with the treatment of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is recognized the dislocation of it when it is in the lower parts because of the titillic; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the sound muscle, since you find among them a manifest diversity; and you find in the head of the concave muscle and below the titillic from the touch of the head of the muscle, just like a void, and the patient cannot reduce their hand to the golden shoulder, nor can they move it at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from the foot or above, and then you find a manifest touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And of this dislocation, a light reduction is made when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister raises their hand to the upper parts; and then stops the tied poultices under the titillation of it, and raises the joint strongly in its own place, and the minister raises their hand, and extends it there; and then stops it there so that it returns gently.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	Perhaps because of what we have said does not return, and so from the beginning it is necessary to accelerate the dislocation, for several days, then it happens that the patient should be bathed in warm water and administered an embrocation that softens and relaxes, thus if it cools quickly, and fenugrec, and melillot in water, and it should be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be placed on their back and stopped under the titillation of it, waiting for a hand to be inserted between levitation and stricture, and then the doctor stops the heel of the foot on the sphere, and raises the head of the muscle in a vertebra, and touches the hand of the patient so that it is not bruised at the parts below, and another minister holds the head of the patient, so that it is not bruised at the parts below, because then it will return to its own place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want, reduce it according to this method: and it is that you should present yourself in front of a man whose length is longer than the patient's, and he is on the side of that bed, and insert your muscle below the titillation of the patient and raise the titillation of it to the upper parts until the patient is suspended in the air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the lower parts of the back.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	Perhaps the patient is lighter, then it happens that I have another cause that is suspended, so that gravity affects it, because the dislocation returns quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced in this way according to another method: and it is that a long stick with a rounded figurehead, like a pile driver, which is not large nor subtle, should be fixed into the ground; then you stop it on top of the patient's foot, and the patient stands according to the length of the stick, and then their hand is extended to the lower parts of the other side; and their body is extended from the other part strongly, because the joint returns to its own place quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce it for all the reasons we have said, then use this cure: and it is that you take a stick of a quantity whose length is two arms, and its width is four fingers, and its thickness is adjusted on the surface of the titillation according to this form.
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And then place the rounded head on top, tied with linen threads so that the stick does not hurt the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then stop it under the titillation of the patient, and their hand or arm is extended over the stick to the lower parts, and tie the stick to the assistant and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then stop the arm on a scale of stairs according to the width, and the hand is extended to the lower parts, and the other body is suspended from the other side, because the joint enters quickly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument of it is completed according to whatever method is possible for you, and then it happens that you stop under the titillation sphere of a hand's quantity; and then you prepare an emplaster made from powder of moly and album of egg whites over all the muscle, thus it is revolved above, and then you strengthen below the titillation with decent stricture; and the ligament is revolved over the emplaster, and the hand of it is annexed to its neck, and it should be left, and not be bruised for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it happens that the patient's food should be stopped little by little, until the member is comforted, because it is easier to bring about their health.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food should be given more abundantly, around seven or eight, and an exercise of movement should be done; and so if it is stopped and not softened, then it will be healthy.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	Perhaps the joint is dislocated many times due to humidity that affects it or for another cause, then it happens that there should be administered a cautery with three tractions, according to what has been said in the chapter on cauteries.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and seven days have passed, the ligament and joint are not stopped, and the emplaster and stricture are reduced over several times, and it is not stopped and you cannot elevate that arm to the upper parts, then you will know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, are either inscribed or extended or softened, and you will know that the joint will not be fixed in its own place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	Regarding the dislocation of that which is done from the foot and knee or the back parts, the reduction is done with impulse and extension in the hands, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And another stricture should be administered to it, and care for it until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	If the disease settles into the limb with gravity and slowness in its movement, then the patient uses many exhausted remedies within so that the gravity is alleviated and returns to its natural state.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the treatment of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You know that the joint of the hip is dislocated with difficulty and similarly returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated in all parts, and especially in the part in front of the part behind, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from you, because it is evident from the misalignment or maladjustment according to some figure that is dislocated, and when you adjust the dislocated hip to its place, it is clearly declared manifestly, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch with that muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And it is necessary to treat the hips, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before it reaches a chronic state, because if it reaches a chronic state, difficult is the reduction of it, and hardly can it be fully healed; and especially when it is in the back parts, because worse is all other species of dislocation, and of greater pain, and many exhausted remedies are used against that, which leads to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce, is that its hand should be extended in two directions, and its arm should be expanded, and the muscles of the thigh are placed over the hip and below it, and the poultice envelops the joint with the tips of its own hands, or at the base of its palm, until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the front parts, then it returns thus that it bends its hand with its own hand, until it strikes the hip at the base of its palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer a vigorous extension and very strong force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is necessary for two ministers to extend the arm, and hold that position with two ministers so that it is not removed from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then return the arm to its whole part, because it is enveloped by a doubled cloth wrapped long over its hand, or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the thigh touches the joint with its hand, until it has some oil for so that it is those causes that help in lubricating the joint to facilitate; and then envelop the joint with a strong poultice until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then the reduction of it is necessary to be placed on that plaster in which it is stipulated and exception made in album of Houour, and it is extended in a strict descending structure, and the arm is suspended from the pillar, and left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it is dislocated; and so if the joint is formed in its own place, then you loosen the bandage of it and leave it thus.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see the joint is not strengthened, then you repeat the plaster and bandage, and leave it thus for some days until it is fully strengthened; and then loosen it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens that the gravity falls on the reduction of the joint, and its disposition is in movement, then administer humidity in bath and subtle friction, and compress, until it is alleviated; or pause over the joint alleviated, so it is anointed with a thick ointment; and then it is bound, and leave it thus on the bone day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then remove that, and put it in bath; and when it sweats, then you rub the joint with tempered friction, and then repeat over that alleviated, so it is rounded by motion, once, and the second, and the third.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	in the instrument of bath, until it is cleaned.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, pause over that moist and scaled wound with border and stretch over that; and do some remedies, because it is moist and reduces to its own disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder, which is of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The shoulder of the hand sometimes is dislocated, and the reduction of its dislocation is easier, and on the contrary it is of other joints, but especially it is necessary that there be velocity in the reduction of it at the hour in which it is dislocated, before the place becomes chronic or falls into a chronic state.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the joint of the hand of the patient on a table and the minister extends the hand of that, and the thigh places its hand or its palm over the vicinity of the joint, and envelops it until it returns to its own place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But especially it is necessary that it be considered if the palm has been placed on the belly of the hand, then the patient places the back of their hand on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is preceding the back of the hand, then the position of the hand of that minister is precisely over the table, so that the hand of the thigh falls upon that vicinity of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	Therefore, if you return immediately, it is good; and if not, then the abscess will become worse, and it will be difficult to cure; and do not delay, because if you do not, you will not suffer nor have relief from the reduction of the pus that passes in a few days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	Perhaps the Roman Emperor's joint is twisted according to its crookedness; and do not notice any cause in the patient, except that the hand is softened and cannot hold any cause; then you know that the nerves are pinched or crushed, and then it is not born in them unless they are strengthened with a pointed cautery for the correction of their case and fortifying their confidence.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the illness is returned, then stop on the abscess which we have recommended, and it will be laid down and strengthened for five days; and then it will be dislocated and laid down, and the patient's hand will be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	Perhaps if the movement of it is stopped and accidently falls into some gravity, then there will be a flow of water and friction of certain evacuated things, until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the cure of dislocation of the toes.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Certain evacuated things dislocate the toes completely apart.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a toe among those is dislocated to the back of the palm or to the belly of it, then hold the toe and push back the dislocation with the tied fingers, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the toe, and suspend it in a way that the part which is dislocated is released, and leave it like that for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and extend it until it is straightened out in that same week.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, lay it according to that narration, and do not cease to dislocate it during the day and exercise its movement, and lay it at night; and do this for some days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do similarly to this, if it is dislocated at the belly of the hand, and lay it in that same part and do the first operation again, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do this when it is dislocated at other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the cure of dislocation of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it happens to one of the vertebrae of the back or neck a complete dislocation, and so many vertebrae are removed from their places, then there is no cure, because death will come to the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And it is said that the evacuation of the patient's effort is outside their will, and cannot retain it; and many evacuated things are softened in certain members of it or two legs of it or two arms of it, or one of those; or a vertebrae is removed from its place, because many evacuated things are removed and many evacuated things make the removal of those into four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then that has been removed to the back parts and is named paralysis.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	Perhaps the cure of it is that then you consider if the paralysis occurs from weakness, because then there is no cure nor complete healing of that.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	Perhaps in that which is seen by chance or by percussion or similarly to those, the Ancients discovered the ways of cure with verbose sermons, from which I will return to profit; perhaps you have already been freed from that from which I have little excuse for the trouble of it, by my own proximity to the intent of my own exposition, in which I have expounded and formed diverse instruments of that which I will show you and expand upon.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And it is said that in paralysis which occurs from the front of the feet, there is no healing nor cure of that; and similarly in that which is done to two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those there is no cure except for that which occurs on the back properly, as I have recommended.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient should be extended on their face above a soft bed prop against the wall, and should be extended below with a moderate pillow so that the feet of it are not lifted.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight beam should be placed, fixed in the ground at the end of the bed around the head of it, and another beam in the air above the feet of it on the other end of the bed.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister holds the beam, and is not fixed in a trench; and another minister holds the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap around the head of the patient and below the thin linen band firmly; and extend the end of the linen to the beam which is above the head of it, and lay that on it; and then strengthen the other band around the thighs of it at the knees, and its legs; and then adjust all the bands and lay them on the other beam which is above the feet of it.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the minister should carefully extend the band to the part of the beam, and do not remove the two beams and the bands from their places in which they are fixed, perhaps because it is not firmly held as I have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	The doctor stops his hands on the spine for strength to return, or he stops on that one table, and then adjusts on the table his six feet to return.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	Perhaps it does not return in this way, then take a table on which the width or length is in the air of three handbreadths, and hollow out the wall of which we have said is proper for the patient a place where the extremity of the table enters.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then stop the flat surface of the table on the spine, and the doctor stops his six feet on the other extremity, and stretches well until the spine is straightened and returns to its own place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, uncover what has been turned around in the hand; and it is that you fix on the ground the head of the patient in the back of two wooden posts, the length of which is one arm, and from the head to the back of two wooden posts; and let the length be between each post a palm, and already it is done in each post a hole where the corpse turns, and each one is firmly fixed on the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a round post in which it turns, and let it be turned around the two holes of the two wooden posts.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the extremity of it there is a hole in which the post is formed, the length of which is one palm in water where it turns; and in the two other wooden posts it is similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then stretch the ligaments that have been stretched on the chest of the patient in the hole where it is beneath the head of him, and the ligaments that have been stretched on his thighs in the turning post where it is beneath his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then there is someone who turns the post and stands as a minister who holds the post with his hand, and the doctor straightens the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the shape of the post:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then since the spine is returned, and the place is straightened, then cover that you stop applying excruciating plaster in album of egg white, and then stop; and then stop on the plaster like a table of which the width is three fingers or around that, and the length of it is as much as takes up the space of the gibbosity, and on the part of the spine above.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be relaxed in the ligament which we have said, and use the patient's subtle nutrient until he is healthy.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if some impediment remains in the place at the end of the healing, then cover that medicines which mollify and linseed are administered on the table for long time, which we have recommended; and already it is administered in that place a thin layer of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some vegetables accidents occur in the back of the two spines, and it is judged for that dislocation; and it is that bone which already warns you so that you do not cover that it is done with a prognosis to him at this medicine, because very far from making you accede death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 21.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the cure of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle do not deviate except for dislocation only, and they do not accede to those which accede to the other small joints with motion and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the ankle is dislocated in four ways, because it is dislocated to the inner parts, or to the outer parts, or to the front parts, or to the back parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated to the inner parts, and little to the front parts or to the back parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation of it to the inner parts is this, when you adjust the leg of the healthy patient with the patient, it is then longer and the denudation is more evident than the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend their knee to the ground, and it is the place where the ligament is apostematized by apostema caut, so that the head of the thigh has already been perverted here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that one to which dislocation occurs to the outer parts is that the accidents of it are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that one to which dislocation occurs to the front parts is that it expands the leg in a complement, but however it does not bend because of the pain that is in the denudation, and if it is perforated to go out and cannot walk on that to the front parts; and its urine is retained and its ligament is apostematized, and from there the ambulation of it is above the ankle.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that one to which dislocation occurs to the back parts is that it does not expand the denudation, nor can it bend the ligament that bends the knee, and the leg of it is shorter than the other, and the ligament is mollified, and the head of the thigh is at that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	Perhaps reduction of the species of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already been antiquated with what you have administered reduction of it and according to its disposition, then it is not in that complete cure; and therefore it does not cover that it has been made a prognosis.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	In that case where the dislocation is recent, it is one of the four species of dislocations, then you should strive to reduce it to its natural position and extend it to the anterior and posterior parts, and move it to the right and left sides, because a strong return is not indicative of another cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this manner, then you should prepare a strong minister and extend the leg of the patient from behind, or hold their hands, or bind what is placed on the leg beneath the knee; and another minister extends the hand of that one below so that they hold the patient's hands beneath the thigh; and you should strengthen the bond around the joint of the thigh, and hold another minister to extend the extremity of the joint.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it is an extension of it or from the anterior to the angle at the part of the elbow, or from the posterior to the part of the back.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And it is the extension of all those in a way that the patient is elevated with their seat off the ground and remains suspended.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns to what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary for all species that require their own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of it itself, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is in the anterior parts, you should resupinate the patient on their back; and then pause with the bonds around the joint of the thigh at that place where the head of the thigh and the space beneath the elbow meet; and then extend the bond from the part of the elbow to the further posterior part of the back.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong minister takes hold of the arms of it, and grasps the large space of the patient's thigh and extends to the anterior parts for vigorous extension, because that returns to its natural place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is of lighter cure in which this member is reduced more easily than the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is excused regarding you and does not obey the entrance in this species of cure altogether, then you should tie both feet of the patient strongly, lightly, over both heels and both knees.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And it is the length of each one by the quantity of four fingers, and the patient's leg is extended more than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the patient is suspended over the head of the bed, and it should be in a massage; and it is the length of it from the ground by the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong youth to move the head of the thigh, and it is suspended with the patient another youth, and the other youth moves the thigh in strong empirical force, because the joint returns to its natural place with velocity.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction, when it is dislocated to the anterior part, you should make the patient sit on a low seat as we have recommended in the previous chapter; and strengthen the bond around the patient's leg properly and around their feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then two stools are placed, one at the patient's feet, and the other at the head; and then two adjusted stools are placed beside the middle of the bed, on which drapes are enveloping, so that the patient is not damaged by the stool being between their thighs, so that the extension to the posterior parts is not disturbed.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each minister extends to their part, and the doctor with their hand guides the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Then, if it obeys to reversal, it will be good greatly; and if not, pause over that diligently and thus as we have said in the previous chapter for that engagement.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But you should make the patient sit on their back quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the posterior parts, then you should make the leg be extended lightly, and it is according to this narrative method on bed; and the doctor places the palm of their right hand on the patient's elbow, and then bends that with the other hand, and in that bending pause, extend to the posterior part at the back of the knee.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the posterior parts, then you should not make the patient be extended to the posterior part, and it is elevated from the ground; but you should make it pause on a hard surface, thus as you make the examination if the ankle of it is dislocated to the anterior part, according to what we have said about the examination of it on two anchors; and it is on their face and the bonds are extended, according to what we have said, there is no failure.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And you should make an administrative compression on the table above the place where the joint is.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Then, when the reduction is completed according to what you should do — and the sign of the reduction of it is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend both legs of the patient, and when you see those bonds and the patient's leg is strengthened and expands, then you know that the member has returned as it should be — and then you adjust both thighs and pause with a bandage and strengthen with a splint thus that the ankle is not hidden in any of the parts; and adhere the patient to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then release the ligament and the plaster, and compare one leg to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those signs in the examination, then you know that the dislocation is already fixed, and therefore leave the patient to rest afterwards.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then return and plaster it, and stretch it according to its first structure, and leave it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then release it, and make it walk on crutches over several days, until it is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the cure of dislocation of the shoulder joint.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The shoulder joint is dislocated in three ways, because it is dislocated forward, and backward, and downward more than upward; and sometimes it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of it is that it commands the patient to apply their leg to the thigh; then you know that the shoulder joint is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its ways is to make the patient straighten up, and if possible, extend their leg, placing their foot on the ground; then attach the two [pieces of] cloth to the face of it, and place their foot between them; and then make the shoulder joint return to its place with the help of your palms, holding them between the pieces of cloth above the shoulder joint with force, and another servant extends their foot until the shoulder joint returns to its position.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of reduction of it is that its leg adheres to the thigh without labor or effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then plaster it and make the leg adhere to the thigh, and then bind them together with a bandage for three days or four, and then release them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not allow the patient to walk for several days, until they are healthy and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	If the reduction of it to you is excused, then administer strong extension to the ligaments which are involved in the cure of the aforementioned injury.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the cure of dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Some ankle joints are removed by small movement, and some joints are dislocated according to their completeness, and the dislocation of it is made either backward or forward.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the dislocation of it is that the ankle becomes swollen preceding the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure of its movement is by gentle reduction, and it is that it should be extended with facility and ease until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the cure of it when it is dislocated completely, you should make the patient straighten up, and hold that with a strong and valiant servant behind the two pieces of cloth on the middle place of it.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you put your right hand straightening the foot on the upper part, and your left hand on the lower part of the foot at the place of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the foot to you with your right hand, and then with your left hand for two inches, and then extend it with your left hand; and place the toes of the foot in a straight line from the leg.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that for two inches according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then place the toes of the foot on the leg at the third inch, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Then if it returns to one inch or two according to this method, and if the foot becomes swollen, it is good; and if not, then repeat the operation, because it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if the reduction of it is prohibited with what we have recommended, then make the patient sit on their two feet on the ground, and stretch a pillow strongly on the ground, and place it between their thighs, and you have enveloped it with a cloth so that the patient does not move.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then the servant of it holds its thighs, and then another servant extends the foot with their hands or with a ligament that lies on the neck of the foot; and then extend that servant against extension of the foot, and the pillow is extended between the thighs of the patient retaining it, so that the body of it is not pulled towards the lower parts from its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the doctor reduces the dislocation with their hands, and another servant holds the healthy thigh at the lower parts, so that the dislocation returns with facility.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you the health of the reduction of it, then pause and plaster strongly, and bind the foot with a strong ligament to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And beware that you do not touch or guard the nerves which are behind the ankle, so that the ligament on it is not violent and holds it strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it for two days or three; and if the ligament is softened, stretch it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And you remove that from the third day or on the fourth, and forbid the patient from strenuous activity for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	Perhaps it is forgotten to administer that space, it is not safe that the dislocation is not above it dissolved and corrupted, and then do not receive a cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if you encounter a hot aposteme, then take care that you administer in the cooling of the water in which our narration precedes, in another place of cure and of wrapping, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the Cure of Dislocation of the Toes of the Feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is necessary that one who is dislocated be placed in a little extension of their trouble; and this is not difficult, because it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	Perhaps the dislocation is in some nodes of the toe of the foot, then it is necessary to make the patient sit on the edge of a chair or on a table, and it should be standing thus as if it were a nave.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on your feet, and stop the toe from going beyond what is imagined of the joints, and then calcify that which has gone to the toe until it returns, and see that it is already placed and does not appear in the eminent place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then stop putting the belly of the foot on a table that holds the whole foot, which has two cups, and then strengthen that which is in structured decent firmness for three days; and then remove that and make it rest from walking for many days, until it is strengthened and its recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the Species of Dislocation that are Caused by a Blow or a Fracture or any other Violent Means.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When you encounter some cause of those, and you persevere in the cure of that and in the restoration of it, many successful outcomes will follow, far from death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that it is not necessary to presume about the cure of the presument, but rather one who is skilled in the art, from long usage, merciful and piteous, tardy, not hasty nor presumptuous; and who uses at the beginning of medicines that calm apostemes so much alone, and leaves the patient to divine judgment, not to the one to whom you hope for salvation, but rather from alleviation of the malady, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then it is necessary to hasten so much to remove the cause at the beginning, because meanwhile an hot aposteme develops.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the limb returns according to what we want, then administer a regimen that calms the hot aposteme and cures the wound with what is convenient for it among the dry desiccative remedies.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is with a fracture and you encounter separated bones, then you make the statement of theirs, and do in that what we have said about simple maladies of that which is preceded in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And beware and avoid according to your prudence that which is intrumental in the ways of fear, according to what has been preceded in my predication; because it is better for you to serve your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more salutations to your cosmos as they are in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the paragraphs of Albucasim, perfectly full of those which God may bless.
Amen.	Amen.
